title: Product Manager
description:
Company Description

We’re the world’s leading sports technology company, at the intersection between sports, media, and betting. More than 1,700 sports federations, media outlets, betting operators, and consumer platforms across 120 countries rely on our know-how and technology to boost their business.

Job Description

Position: Product Manager

Location: London/Linz

Sportradar is hiring a Senior Product Manager (3+ years of PM experience) for Odds tribe that is keen to join us in our mission to use data and technology to keep betting operators ahead of the curve with the products and services they need to manage their sportsbook. Our products are used by hundreds of betting operators to provide punters with fun and engaging experiences and advance sports betting.

ABOUT THE TEAM:

We have a couple of senior product manager roles available across our product teams and the common thread across all these roles is that you will be working on challenging immersive problems with a... massive impact on the sports betting industry and its evolution.

Each delivery team is scoped around a meaningful problem that we need to solve to achieve our broader group product strategy, and you will join a cross-functional team led by a group product manager alongside design, engineering, analysts, etc. At the Senior Product Manager level you can expect to work on complex, impactful problems that are critical to delivering on our strategy. Not only do you need to be an expert in product execution, but you also must possess a strong fluency with data to drive decisions as well as a proven ability to influence your immediate team and stakeholders.

THE CHALLENGE:
• Build and execute on ambitious product goals and roadmap, aligning leadership, partner teams and key stakeholders across the company to your plan to deliver against your goals.
• Set clear and actionable product objectives with measurable results at a quarterly level that align with the strategic direction of the company.
• Work with engineering to drive the culture of SLO-based approach and use product KPI data to present meaningful reports to senior leadership and customers.
• Set the direction, motivate the team, and drive progress across your cross-functional team.
• Identify and surface opportunities for your product to offer industry-leading, differentiated experiences that further the company’s commitment to reimagine how digital content and cutting edge technology can be used to create engaging stories for fans, bettors and athletes across sports.
• You will be working on complex and exciting problems to optimize and advance our content offering across sports and our existing solutions and platforms whilst also innovating and driving new product solutions.

YOUR PROFILE:
• A proven record of building exceptional products that meaningfully solve the most important customer whilst problems achieving key business goals.
• 3+ years of product management experience, preferably on B2B products.
• Specific experience in the betting domain and/or trading platform product management is a major advantage.
• Specific experience with legacy migration work is considered a plus.
• Specific experience in companies in a hyper-growth stage practicing scaled product management in a product-led company is considered an advantage.

WHO ARE YOU:
• We are looking for change agents, who challenge the status quo and bring innovative solutions while enhancing the cultures and companies in which they operate.
• You have experience of working in a product-led companies that have a strong partnership with engineering to deliver on ambitious goals.
• You are comfortable in a fast-paced environment where you will set and be held accountable to ambitious goals.
• You hold yourself to the highest standards consistently and you raise the quality bar with every delivery that you do. You expect the same from your immediate team.
• You keep the customer and the business value at the center of everything that you do.
• You continuously strive for perfection and improvement, but you can clearly prioritize your development areas based on the environment in which you operate. You love to learn and recognize that there is always room to grow your skills and broaden your impact.
• You have experience running and structuring continuous product discovery, specifically focusing on using customer research. You are an expert in examining your discovery findings within the business context and prioritizing based on highest value fastest delivery method.
• You are a confident and competent product leader with excellent communication skills (both verbal and written) who can create the right narratives and share your ideas with all stakeholders (regardless of the level) and your immediate team.

OUR OFFER:
• Chance to work with highly skilled multi-national team of technology enthusiasts.
• High level of flexibility and work-life balance – hybrid office model.
• State-of-the-art equipment of your choice.
• Direct and global impact on shaping the next generation of engagement and sports data technology services.
• Investment in your continued professional development.

Additional Information

Sportradar is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to encourage diversity within our teams. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to among other things, your background, status, or personal preferences

responsibilities: Build and execute on ambitious product goals and roadmap
Work with engineering to drive SLO-based approach and use product KPI data
Motivate the team and drive progress across cross-functional team
Identify opportunities for product to offer differentiated experiences
Work on complex problems to optimize and advance content offering

title: Product Manager - Quant Analytics & Data Solutions - CTO Office
description:
Product Manager - Quant Analytics & Data Solutions - CTO Office

Who we are / the team:
Bloomberg's CTO Office is the future-looking technical and product arm of Bloomberg L.P. We envision, design, and prototype the next generation infrastructure, hardware, and applications for the Bloomberg Terminal. Our projects include machine learning-powered products, cloud computing infrastructure and strategy, open source stewardship, natural language processing, and more. We are passionate about what we do.

At Bloomberg, we have the richest and most comprehensive financial datasets and analytics in the world. Our powerful enterprise products serve a large and diverse client base from data intensive analytics to trading. The Bloomberg Quant Platform (BQuant) is the frontier of our work - a platform for quantitative finance professionals to rapidly analyze data and research trading strategies.

What's in it for you:
We are looking for an experienced professional with a background in designing... and delivering products for large scale data and quant analytics to help us create an industry leading solution. This is a unique opportunity to join a cross-functional team with Product, Engineering, Quant, CTO, and Client teams. The team is global, located in London, New York and San Francisco. We are expanding the team, along with similar hiring in our Engineering department, to accelerate the range of products and use cases we support within BQuant.

Your role:
As a product manager, you will be responsible for identifying target markets, challenges worth solving, and how to solve them, as well as executing upon that strategy. Examples of areas you could be working on include:

• Data solutions to help customers discover, access and manage data to drive quantitative research, analytics and application building in BQuant. Liaison with our data-producing teams at Bloomberg to onboard new content, ensure data quality, design and deliver turnkey data access.
• Quant analytics libraries for users of BQuant and the rest of our team who are creating specific workflow solutions on top such as natural language processing (NLP), backtesting, trading systems integration etc.
• Product ownership of revenue generating BQuant offerings ranging from core solutions for equity, fixed income, and macro quants to advanced solutions including Intraday Analytics and Textual Analytics.
We'll trust you to:

• Formulate the vision and execution strategy for your product area. Drive the design and delivery of end-to-end products that are built on the Bloomberg Quant Platform and Bloomberg's Data and Services.
• Own the roadmap and backlog, taking into account external and internal customer input, product strategy, value propositions, competitor analysis and operational requirements.
• Be a company thought leader on data and quant workflows from trading strategy ideation to portfolio construction and management to trading and implementation.
You'll need to have:

• 7+ years in quantitative research, portfolio management, or execution research ideally across multiple asset classes
• 3+ years of product management or equivalent experience within a leading financial institution or financial technology provider designing and delivering quantitative products including Python libraries and APIs
• Deep knowledge of use cases across buy side and sell side, asset classes, and different trading strategies.
• Ability to effectively communicate and collaborate with engineers, UX, data scientists, and senior management.
We'd love to see:

• Experience with the management and usage of multi-asset, alternative and proprietary data in finance
• An advanced degree in a STEM subject or Economics / Finance
• Familiarity with Bloomberg products including the Bloomberg Terminal and Enterprise products
• Experience with public cloud providers such as AWS or Azure Bloomberg is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of age, ancestry, color, gender identity or expression, genetic predisposition or carrier status, marital status, national or ethnic origin, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, sexual and other reproductive health decisions, parental or caring status, physical or mental disability, pregnancy or parental leave, protected veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, or any other classification protected by applicable law.

Bloomberg is a disability inclusive employer. Please let us know if you require any reasonable adjustments to be made for the recruitment process. If you would prefer to discuss this confidentially, please email amer_recruit@bloomberg.net

responsibilities: identify target markets
solving challenges and executing strategy
design and deliver end-to-end products
liaison with data-producing teams
ensure data quality
drive quantitative research, analytics and application building

title: Digital Markets - Data and Analytics Product Manager - Vice President
description:
Job Summary:

As a Data and Analytics Product Manager, you will be responsible for driving digital transformation across Markets, including automation, distribution and execution. The Markets Client Portal team is responsible for the client facing platform, J.P. Morgan Markets (JPMM), where Markets products are delivered digitally to clients. The team are in the process of modernizing the platform providing a personalized experience bringing together pre-trade content, data and analytics offerings while increasing transaction flow. The data and analytics product manager will lead the data strategy for J.P. Morgan Markets ensuring a comprehensive understanding of client digital behaviors and interactions. You will be passionate about using data to accelerate product development, drive business growth, and improve the customer experience.

Job Responsibilities:
• Acting as a visionary and thought leader in transforming how data is used across markets products and services.
• Owning the... development and delivery of product data to support strategic business objectives, advanced analytics, metrics, and reporting. Continuously seek opportunities to streamline processes.
• Partnering with aligned product owners, technical owners, and data scientists, to drive increased business value through the identification of data required to support advanced analytics outcomes such as customer segmentation and personalization leveraging AI/ML.
• Providing subject matter expertise with respect to the content and use of data in the product and associated business area.
• Creating insightful visualizations to show adherence to key performance indicators from diverse complex datasets.
• Leading the development and implementation of data governance policies and a common metrics model enabling JPMM metrics data to be combined with other data products and services.
• Influencing resources to resolve identified data issues in a timely manner. Proactively identify gaps in processes, systems or resources that may hinder the business development. Make timely and informed decisions based on thorough analysis, assessment, and markets trend and research.
• Innovate on new ways to leverage our unique data assets to create new analytics services and products.
• Managing large scale migration of clients onto the new platform owning segmentation of clients to be onboarded.

Required qualifications, capabilities, and skills:
• Understanding of how to use data to drive business value leveraging a range of analytical tools (e.g. SQL, Python)
• Demonstrated experience in managing/deploying AI/ML models at scale and in the use of data visualization tools and data analysis software.
• Adept use of business intelligence and data visualization tools such as Tableau/Alteryx.
• Experience in a team lead role within a data-driven organization and track record of working with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, engineers, and business stakeholders.
• Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
• Proven experience as a Digital Product Manager in banking or financial industry.
• Analytical mindset to ensure we commercialize the products that deliver value.
• Quick learner with excellent attention to detail and strong work ethic

responsibilities: Driving digital transformation across Markets
Modernizing the client facing platform
Leading the data strategy for J.P. Morgan Markets
Creating insightful visualizations
Developing and implementing data governance policies
Managing large scale migration of clients onto the new platform
Using data to drive business value
Managing/deploying AI/ML models at scale
Use of business intelligence and data visualization tools
Working with cross-functional teams
Explaining complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders

title: Group Product Manager - Scalable Growth
description:
Company Description

We're looking for a Group Product Manager to join our growing Growth Marketing Product team in London. Your mission is to lead a squad of Product/Engineering Teams, working with Marketing to help scale impact across organic and paid growth. Be the leader when it comes to marketing tech as well as its deeper integration into Wise core products. You'll work alongside a dedicated and passionate group of product managers, designers, researchers, analysts and engineers. This is a senior role for someone who is driven by business impact and leads a team of Product Managers.

Job Description

You'll contribute by leading multiple teams responsible for building:
• Wise's CMSs, acquisition SEO products (tools, services & directories) responsible for driving organic growth to Wise properties.
• Growth product teams like Wise recommend a friend programme and price comparison.
• Web tracking infrastructure, native app measurement setup, our email and localisation... infrastructure, and microservices passing data back to vendors like Google and Meta.
• Manage 5 direct reports and setting the overall frame of reference for decision-making in the teams, balancing tradeoffs and ultimately ensuring the team works well and on the most impactful problems it can.
• Influencing big decisions in allocation of spend together with marketing stakeholders while being part of the product organization.
This role will give you the opportunity to:
• Directly contribute to our mission to make money without borders the new normal - you will need to figure out and build solutions so that our customers can move money instantly, conveniently, transparently, and - eventually - for free
• Build world-class products: The role is a unique opportunity to build innovative, state-of-the-art solutions with a global impact.
• Choose your path to impact - we believe people are most empowered when they can act autonomously. So rather than telling you what to do, you'll work with your team to create a vision of your own. Of course, you can always gather feedback from smart, curious people across Wise but you'll have the freedom to make your own calls
• Enable marketing channels on customer products by identifying and implementing strategies that improve performance and enhance user experience.
• Work with a cross-functional team, including engineering, UX, analytics, content and collaborate with other teams across product departments to drive performance and content initiatives and ensure successful product launches.
• Work closely with the SEO business team to identify opportunities to get the most out of SEO and to drive traffic, engagement, and conversion.
• Develop and execute the product roadmap and strategy, including defining product goals, priorities, and KPIs.
• Act as a leader - You will build and inspire your own team, but also other teams to contribute to our mission. Inspire teams with your ideas, knowledge and self-starting attitude
Qualifications
• Customer-focused - You've worked on a product with thousands or even millions of customers, and built a deep understanding of the people who used your product. You're able to define the impact of product investments you make.
• Experience in performance marketing, or ad-tech product management.
• You have a demonstrable record of collaborating with both paid and organic marketing teams, and are familiar with the challenges they face in measuring their performance.
• You're familiar with a wide range of marketing technology across both web and app measurement.
• Excellent product management skills, with the ability to lead cross-functional teams and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
• You're data-driven - You are able to dive into data to identify opportunities and then measure your impact. You prioritise the value you can add to customers, and can get the entire company behind you by telling stories with data.
• You have a good technical understanding - help your team prioritise technological investments, tech debt reduction, bugs and new features.
• You communicate clearly and logically - You are able to effectively frame problems to influence across the team. You are comfortable communicating with internal and external partners on challenging issues, whether in written format or at sprint planning with the team
• You're not afraid of being a true lead, helping your team with hiring, learning skills you don't know today to unblock things everywhere needed. You don't stick to a "by the book" product manager role definition. You get it done
Additional Information

For everyone, everywhere. We're people building money without borders - without judgement or prejudice, too. We believe teams are strongest when they are diverse, equitable and inclusive.

We're proud to have a truly international team, and we celebrate our differences.
Inclusive teams help us live our values and make sure every Wiser feels respected, empowered to contribute towards our mission and able to progress in their careers.

If you want to find out more about what it's like to work at Wise visit Wise.Jobs .

Keep up to date with life at Wise by following us on LinkedIn and Instagram

title: Group Product Manager (Growth)
description:
Instapro Group is looking to hire a highly passionate, data-driven and experienced product leader to manage, lead, grow, and mentor up to four product managers for customer facing teams in our marketplace.

We run marketplaces in multiple countries which allows homeowners to post homeservices jobs and to connect with reliable tradespeople to hire them for the execution of jobs and tradespeople can reliably find the jobs they need.

As Group Product Manager, you will mentor, coach and manage the Product Managers in your teams, and align with your peers and management. As a motivating leader, you will lead the development and continuous improvement to drive homeowner growth through our existing acquisition channels (e.g. SEO, Paid acquisition) and new channels.

This position requires a business mindset, metrics focus and a value driven approach. The ideal candidate combines marketplace experience with a consultative mindset and strong communication skills. You are used to partnering... with product people and higher management alike in a fast-paced and team-driven environment.

Your role includes the following:
• Lead a team of product managers and provide guidance, coaching, and mentorship to help them achieve their goals and deliver high-quality products in our core marketplace
• Together with your PMs, authoring and reviewing strategic documents in a-synchronous discussions
• Stewarding big strategic opportunities across different teams, including driving an inspiring vision and coordinating required work across adjacent teams
• Aligning team contributions and product solutions to the company strategy
• Together with your peers in Engineering (Engineering Manager) and UX (UX Manager) ensuring that your teams can turn that strategy into a concrete product roadmap and execute on it
• Work closely with business, operations and marketing stakeholders to identify opportunities that can drive revenue growth and improve customer experience.
• Report on core metrics in the dynamic marketplace
• Together with your product peers evangelize an evidence-based and experiment-driven culture in our product development department
• Multi-year experience in working in product management for customer facing products
• 7+ years of experience in product management
• 3+ years of experience leading and managing product managers
• Experience in two-sided marketplaces, ideally B2B2C with deep understanding of marketplace dynamics
• Proven track record in delivering customer value which drives growth
• Attention to detail and ability to switch from the managerial plane to stepping in when needed
• Experience working in an Agile development environment.
• Strong problem-solving skills and ability to navigate complex technical challenges.
• Strong communicator able to translate complex metrics and dynamics into comprehensible story-telling
• Strong interpersonal and communication skills in English, both in written and oral form; which enables you to work well in our distributed and hybrid organisational setup with emphasis on a-synchronous information flows

Why you’ll enjoy working at the Instapro Group

You can make an Impact. Joining Instapro Group is an opportunity to help crack the code in one of the last big industries to become digital-first. We’re leaders in our markets, yet small enough for everyone to make a real difference.

We care. We don’t believe in one size fits all. Whether it’s flexibility in your working hours, your location, or opportunities to advance and grow, you’ll find a supportive and open culture designed to help our team members thrive.

These are the benefits you'll enjoy:
• 33 days holiday (including bank holidays) + 1 annual bonus leave day after 5, 8, 10, 15 and 20 work anniversaries (capped at 5 bonus leave days)
• 5% employer pension contribution
• Eligibility to receive stock appreciation rights
• Comprehensive private medical insurance with AXA
• Routine treatments health cash plan
• Enhanced parental leave
• Hybrid work environment
• Training support
• Generous hybrid allowance
• Commuting allowance for office days

These are the values that guide everything we do:
• We put integrity first. We are authentic, transparent and respectful.
• We are all stewards. We are stewards of the company on behalf of all stakeholders.
• We follow the evidence. We are objective, evidence-based and pragmatic in our decision-making.
• We never stop learning. We are open-minded and curious.
• We win together. We collaborate and earn trust with our colleagues.
• We are inclusive. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive company.

Read our values in full here

Interested in applying? Submit your application below and we will get back to you

title: Assistant Product Manager - Soft Accessories UK
description:
About Us

Centric Brands is a leading lifestyle brand collective that designs, sources, markets and sells high quality products in multiple segments, including women’s, men’s and kid’s apparel, accessories, entertainment and beauty. Centric Brands is focused on our customers and our brands that will drive the company’s future growth. We are defined by innovation as we seize new opportunities and thrive in an environment informed by creativity and thinking that is both analytical and outside the box. Centric Brands reflects a team built on respect, for others and for the hard work it takes to achieve our goals and build our bright future together.

Specific Responsibilities Would Include

The Assistant Product Manager, reporting directly to the Senior Product Manager, plays a pivotal role in supporting with assortment curation for our accessory brands- Allsaints, Coach, Kate Spade and Michael Kors. It's imperative that these ranges accurately embody the brand’s DNA, fulfill market... demands, and directly contribute to revenue growth. The Assistant Product Manager will collaborate with the US Design team to uphold excellence and exemplify innovation at its finest.

ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES
• Support assortment curation and manage all product data. This includes managing product samples, gathering product information from US design teams, preparing seasonal selling materials (line sheets and customer price files), and ensuring product information flows correctly between systems (Europe Order Book, PLM, SAP) and teams (design, sales, and production).
• Manage the European market calendar and communicate key dates with the EU Sales Team.
• Prepare seasonal margin reporting to review with the Product and Finance team. Working closely with design to ensure global margin targets are hit.
• Manage SAP/material product extension, partner with compliance and design teams on material curation for the European market.
• Analyse in-season sales with the sales team, create seasonal brand hindsight, and leverage this information to create future product and sales strategies.
• Advocate for European customers in global product reviews on product needs.
• Maintain and communicate e-commerce merchandising information to the sales team.
• Own marketing support for Europe, communication on brand assets, and imagery.

Our Best Fit Candidate Would Have
• Excellent attention to detail and strong administration skills.
• Demonstrated a history of building and maintaining strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders and the ability to work with teams in different geographic regions.
• Team-oriented, solution-oriented, positive attitude, strong time management.

System Experience:
• Excel: must be proficient (lookup, pivot, etc.).
• PowerPoint
• Experience Preferred: SAP

OUR VALUES:

We at Centric Brands are proudly committed to our guiding principles: The 4C’s and aim to attract and retain employees who truly live and breathe these in in their everyday life at Centric Brands
• We Are Brand Centric:As creative, multi-faceted experts, we are committed to protecting our brands’ DNA by generating long-term value for our strategic business partners and licensors.
• We Are Business Centric:As leaders in operational excellence, we have created the foundation for a transformational organization — the platform that enables superior end-to-end agility.
• We Are Customer Centric:Consumer-driven, we deliver unparalleled customer solutions thatgenerate remarkable performance and exceptional experiences.
• We Are People Centric:Renowned in talent management, we are a dynamic, transparent, and unified culture. We have created a place where people love to work and contribute their best.

#LI-HR1

#LI-Hybrid

title: Product Manager, Reuters
description:
We are looking for a Product Manager to help us evolve our portfolio of products for the next generation, with an initial focus on our pictures (photography) services. From concept to market launch and beyond, the candidate will be a key member of our multi-disciplined team, ensuring every aspect of the products they lead delights our global customer base by being the best it can be.

Our products and services are routinely used by many of the world’s largest media brands to tell their stories. The successful candidate will be responsible for working with customers across the globe to determine their needs and translate them into viable and compelling products which improve customer experience and drive growth. Close collaboration is also needed with internal stakeholders, including technology, finance, sales, marketing and editorial colleagues.

Our product team come from a range of backgrounds: from editorial, to design, technology, data analytics, and commercial; what unifies them... is the desire to constantly innovate to create the best possible holistic experience for our customers.

We are looking for someone who is inspired by the idea of applying their product management expertise to build the next generation of reliable, trusted news & information services.

About the Role

As our Product Manager you will:
• Act as product manager for key Reuters products (initial focus will be on Reuters Pictures photography products).
• Create and execute a compelling vision for the future direction of our pictures (photography) product, with a particular focus on the opportunities & implications created by new and emerging technologies, especially artificial intelligence.
• Lead the development, launch, and all aspects of the product life-cycle for these products.
• Conduct qualitative and quantitative analysis to determine the overall health of products and identify new opportunities for improvements, new ways of working, and new areas of development.
• Work with editorial, technology, legal, customer support, and other teams to ensure that our practices, templates, and procedures make us easy to do business with.
• Plan & deliver features with an end-to-end approach: from camera through to customer (encompassing production systems, back-end processing, distribution platforms & front-end UI elements).
• Manage exceptions and unexpected changes to our product portfolio and operations.
• Work with the wider Thomson Reuters organization to develop, support and ensure adherence to corporate level best practices.

Key Relationships:
• Customers (especially publishers, news organizations, and digital platforms)
• Sales, distribution and business development teams
• Technology development team
• Reuters photographers and other editorial teams
• Suppliers
• Legal staff

About the Role

You're a fit for the Product Manager if you have:
• Significant experience in a relevant role, either directly as a product manager, or working in a similar cross-functional capacity, ideally in a news, media, digital, data, technology or rights management business.
• Creative thinking skills, ability to make connections, find patterns and use their imagination to create the best possible customer experience.
• General knowledge of, and genuine interest in the photography, news & media industries and how trends and practices differ globally.
• Must have maturity, poise, and communication skills suitable to interact directly and build trust with high-profile customers and partners.
• Proven ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authority.
• Ability to establish and manage 3rd party relationships including suppliers and collaboration partnerships.
• Prioritization and multi-tasking skills are essential.
• As our business is built on trust, a strong sense of ethics and ability to communicate precisely are required for this role.

Desired Skills:
• Strong product management skills, e.g. direct experience in areas such as creating a compelling product vision, customer requirement analysis, roadmaps, user experience design, etc.
• Experience in working closely with technology development teams, especially in an agile software development environment.
• Experience in developing products in AI & machine learning related areas.
• Ability to use data and analytics to set key success metrics and monitor product performance.
• Ability to develop business cases that support decision making, e.g. in ‘buy vs. build’ scenarios.
• Proficiency in more than one language would be a benefit.
• University degree or equivalent experience in related field(s) preferred.

What’s in it for You?

At Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:
• Global Career: As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunities.
• Learning & Development: On the job learning and coaching. We also have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our journalists.
• Benefits: We offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefits including paid volunteering days.
• Perks: Work alongside Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists and a team who provide unmatched, award-winning coverage of the world’s most important stories.

About Reuters

Reuters is the world’s largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. With unmatched coverage in over 16 languages, and reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters provides trusted intelligence that powers humans and machines to make smart decisions. It supplies business, financial, national and international news to professionals via desktop terminals, the world's media organizations, industry events and directly to consumers.

Reuters: The Real World in Real Time.

#LI-KK1

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 26,000 employees across more than 70 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.

Accessibility

As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.

Protect yourself from fraudulent job postings click here to know more.

More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on https://thomsonreuters.com

title: Product Manager
description:
Join the Future of Crypto as a Product Manager

London - Hybrid team, in-office collaboration for 4 days per week

Up to £100k + attractive benefits

This is not your average research and product development group - they're visionaries dedicated to bridging the gap between fundamental research and groundbreaking commercial products. Specializing in MEV and blockchains, they're on a mission to turn the future of crypto into a tangible reality.

Are you an experienced Product Manager, ready to take on a high impact opportunity, spearheading the "Liquidity Layer" project. You will play a crucial role in simplifying the multi-chain landscape to onboard the next billion users to crypto.

As a Product Manager you will:
• Craft comprehensive product strategies and roadmaps, grounded in research and data.
• Collaborate cross-functionally with engineering, design, marketing, and business development teams.
• Manage the end-to-end product development process, ensuring high-quality, timely... deliveries.
• Make strategic product trade-offs, balancing short and long-term goals.
• Engage with industry players, partners, and clients to gather insights and explore collaborations.

title: Product Development Manager (A2A)
description:
Job Title:

Product Development Manager (A2A)

Overview:

Overview:
Manager, Product Development - Foundry

Who is Mastercard?
Mastercard is a global technology company in the payments industry. Our mission is to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart, and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments, and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. With connections across more than 210 countries and territories, we are building a sustainable world that unlocks priceless possibilities for all.

Overview
Mastercard Foundry is the innovation engine of Mastercard and a hub for new product development. We do this by driving product innovation in emerging technologies and interfaces while focusing on... developing a point of view to enhance existing solutions and new use-cases. We also focus on building revenue generating ecosystems and flywheels that can be standalone in adjacent segments and markets. Examples of focus areas include commercial payments, new payment flows, real time payments, data and services.

Within Foundry, the Manager, Product Development will be supporting the execution of new to market product development in A2A space. Role responsibility including identification, execution, and in-market delivery of new products and solutions. The responsibilities will include execution of near-term opportunities that drive significant in year revenue and strategic differentiation for Mastercard, as well as scoping, identification, in-market testing of longer-term product concepts and solutions
Role:
• Engage in idea generation for new to market A2A products and solutions including workshop facilitation and collateral development.
• Contribute to developing product concepts and prototypes and independently own and deliver key tasks associated with it.
• Partner with Product & Engineering partners and our CX&D team on concept validation and market testing and independently own and deliver key tasks associated with it.
• Contribute / own business case development and planning for individual products.
• Own and deliver high quality collateral materials to facilitate internal decision making.
• Lead cross functional workshops and manage follow up actions to completion.
• Partner with R&D teams by providing prioritized requirements.
• Review and provide feedback on R&D deliverables.

All About You

• In depth understanding of commercial payment ecosystem and expanding role of A2A and real time payments globally.

• Previous experience working in Payments innovation space delivering new to market value propositions.
• Strong product development experience, including rapid opportunity identification, concept development, business model innovation, and in market testing of global products.
• Technical expertise, and experience working with R&D teams
• Flair in connecting people and ideas; ability to operate in a matrix environment

title: Director, Product Management, Cross-Border Payments
description:
Job Title:

Director, Product Management, Cross-Border Payments

Overview:

Who is Mastercard?
Mastercard is a global technology company in the payments industry. Our mission is to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart, and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments, and businesses realize their greatest potential.
Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. With connections across more than 210 countries and territories, we are building a sustainable world that unlocks priceless possibilities for all.

Role:
This position is responsible for supporting the execution of the Mastercard Cross-Border Services Product Management roles and responsibilities. This role works in conjunction with other teams/requestors to draft the business... requirements for product development and complete all product and project readiness activities required to commercialize new features and functionalities.

Act as a SME for all aspects of the product, leading and training internal stakeholders and regional partners on how the products works and why.
Use Aha Road mapping tool to build product roadmap, prioritize and report on the Product Roadmap.

Partner with Product Owners to quantify and elaborate business requirements and ensure what is delivered meets the Product needs and requirements.
Adhere to the product development life cycle and include the Studio and P&E partnership principals to deliver all prioritized projects.

Provide thought leadership to create a compelling product vision for new Cross-Border offerings with enhanced capabilities and business value.

Customer Feedback and Insights:
Collect and assess customer feedback, user data, and market insights to gain insights into pain points and areas for enhancement within Cross-Border payment product. Utilize this feedback to prioritize feature improvements and inform strategic decisions regarding product roadmaps, ensuring alignment with customer needs and market trends.

Stakeholder Collaboration:
Engage in collaborative efforts with stakeholders throughout the organization, spanning sales, marketing, engineering, and customer support, to gather input, align priorities, and propel cross-functional initiatives forward. Serve as the main point of contact for stakeholders seeking information or updates on Cross-Border payment product, ensuring effective communication and coordination across teams.

Ideation and Conceptualization:
Engage in collaborative ideation and conceptualization sessions with stakeholders, including customers, sales teams, and technical experts, to generate innovative ideas tailored to address pain points and capitalize on market opportunities. Forge close partnerships with design and engineering teams to transform these conceptualized ideas into detailed product requirements and prototypes, ensuring alignment with customer needs and market dynamics.

Requirements Definition and Documentation:
Collect and document comprehensive requirements for enhancing Cross-Border payment product, ensuring precision and alignment with stakeholder expectations. Convert business requirements into tangible user stories, acceptance criteria, and technical specifications for the engineering team, facilitating effective implementation and alignment with project objectives.

Feature Prioritization and Roadmap Planning:
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to prioritize the development of features, focusing on business value, customer impact, and technical feasibility. Maintain close oversight of product roadmap planning, ensuring alignment with strategic objectives and evolving customer and market demands.
Release Planning and Execution:
Coordinate closely with engineering teams to strategize and execute product releases, ensuring the punctual delivery of features and improvements. Conduct comprehensive testing and validation of new functionalities to guarantee their quality and reliability prior to customer release.

Prototype Development and Testing:
Supervise the creation of prototypes and minimum viable products (MVPs) to validate new concepts with intended users. Conduct user testing sessions and collect feedback to iterate on prototypes, refining product features before proceeding with full-scale implementation.

Go-to-Market Strategy:
Partner closely with marketing and sales teams to craft effective go-to-market strategies for new products, features, encompassing aspects such as pricing, positioning, and promotional activities. Develop marketing collateral and sales enablement materials to facilitate the successful introduction and adoption of new products in the market.

Performance Tracking and Optimization:
Establish key performance indicators (KPIs) to gauge the effectiveness of new product and features and consistently track performance against predefined targets. Utilize data analytics and user feedback to pinpoint areas for optimization and ongoing improvement, iterating on product features and strategies as necessary to enhance overall performance.

All About You
• Proven track record in product management, with experience in the payments industry or related sectors.
• Strong analytical skills, with the ability to interpret market data and customer insights to drive product decisions.
• Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
• Strategic mindset with a focus on innovation, customer value, and business growth.
• Experience with agile development methodologies and product management tools.
• Knowledge of regulatory requirements and compliance standards in the payments industry is desirable.
• Excellent problem-solving, critical thinking and analytical skills, and ability to think strategically and translate concepts into clear, actionable strategies and tactics;
• Strong self-motivation and organizational skills;
• Ability to build and maintain strong, productive, collaborative working relationships with internal stakeholders over cross-functional teams from multiple countries.
Corporate Security Responsibility
Every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security. All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and therefore, it is expected that the successful candidate for this position must:

• Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
• Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
• Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
• Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines

title: Senior Product Manager
description:
Who we are:

Access Partnership makes innovative technology work for the world.

We’re tech optimists who believe that innovative technology has been the driver of transformative change in the world. As the pace of innovation accelerates, and paradigm shifts across areas including AI, healthcare, space, and climate occur, we believe the potential for economic growth and human progress will increase.

Delivering across 200 markets worldwide, we help businesses navigate complex regulatory challenges, optimise their technologies, accelerate growth, and support governments in designing policies and regulations that attract investment.

Our specialist knowledge runs deep across all areas of digital technology, and we advise and drive every step of the journey; from setting strategy to designing policy, achieving and maintaining compliance, and measuring success.

We join the dots to reduce risks and optimise outcomes, fuelling progress competitively, responsibly, and sustainably.

Through... the powerful partnership of transformative technology and purposeful policy, we’re creating a world where people everywhere can benefit from innovation.

About the department – Commercial Operations

The AP team is looking for an exceptional product leader to work in a creative, fun, and fast-paced environment. This is newly created role, responsible for defining and driving our product strategy, including a global Knowledge Management and content distribution platform and our Enterprise Resource Platform (Oracle NetSuite).

What you’ll do:

As a Senior Product Manager you will be responsible for the vision, strategy, requirements, and implementation of a bespoke Knowledge Management platform that will form the core of AP’s internal operations – and eventually be offered to clients as well. The platform roadmap will also include a Generative AI component, yet to be built. You will also be the Product Manager for our ERP system. The position requires a highly entrepreneurial individual that can set the vision for the team, believes that product and user experience go hand-in-hand, and is not afraid of rolling up their sleeves. The ideal candidate has an extensive background in building 1.0 products and beyond – working with internal and external implementation partners – managing often conflicting priorities and requirements.

As a leader, you will inspire through your words, actions, and frequent, small victories. As a manager, you will focus on clear, prioritized goals. As an individual contributor, you will define and communicate AP’s knowledge management platform strategy, roadmap, plans, and priorities across organizations.

What you can expect to be doing
• Crystallize opportunities and trends into clearly defined business plans & proposals.
• Build a world-class product while influencing across functional and organizational boundaries.
• Select and manage implementation partner(s) for building out the KMS platform.
• Setup process for managing the development cycle (tools, tracking, KPIs, etc.)
• Review and/or write the actual epics and user stories for the KMS and ERP platforms
• Collaborate closely with Marketing and Sales regarding product definition, project schedule, feature scope, definition, and project-related execution.
• Champion efforts to create a world class user experience. This will require an evangelist who believes the customer experience is integral to the company’s success and who inspires the company to create superior products that integrates across different systems
• Prepare and deliver presentations, demonstrations, and product concepts. Typical audiences include executive management, customers, partners, and press.
• Research and evaluate competitive products & solutions
• Lead build, partner and buy scenario planning and execution
• Be the voice for and represent AP’s product organization inside and outside AP

What you’ll need:
• 5+ years experience in Product-oriented roles
• You believe that candour is the foundation of a manager-employee relationship; you believe in maximizing employee productivity and employee job satisfaction; and you believe in individual responsibility and results over consensus
• Experience in leading product discussions and decisions within matrixed organizations comprised of strong individual contributors and managers
• You believe that data is the foundation for decision making and you are willing both to challenge and be challenged
• You have excellent communication and presentation skills
• You have numerous examples having built products from conception to market - addressing the needs of a diverse customer base, as well as building consensus among the company's executive and product leadership groups

Nice to have:
• You have built and launched successful products and have also learned how to take something from 1.0 to 2.0 without getting lost in the process
• Experience working with a globally distributed development organization is strongly preferred
• An undergraduate degree in a technical field, plus a similar postgraduate degree is strongly preferred

What we offer you:

We work in a flexible hybrid model, typically aligning each employee to one of our global offices, with each person spending 2 days per week in the office, and 3 days remote. This role will be based from our London office.

Our diverse, international client base of technology giants, start-ups and governments will provide the opportunity to work on multiple projects on behalf of industry leading companies.

We boast a collaborative working environment, social events and a robust support system. We are committed to providing training and professional development for all colleagues

title: Group Product Manager (Growth)
description:
Instapro Group is looking to hire a highly passionate, data-driven and experienced product leader to manage, lead, grow, and mentor up to four product managers for customer facing teams in our marketplace.

We run marketplaces in multiple countries which allows homeowners to post homeservices jobs and to connect with reliable tradespeople to hire them for the execution of jobs and tradespeople can reliably find the jobs they need.

As Group Product Manager, you will mentor, coach and manage the Product Managers in your teams, and align with your peers and management. As a motivating leader, you will lead the development and continuous improvement to drive homeowner growth through our existing acquisition channels (e.g. SEO, Paid acquisition) and new channels.

This position requires a business mindset, metrics focus and a value driven approach. The ideal candidate combines marketplace experience with a consultative mindset and strong communication skills. You are used to partnering... with product people and higher management alike in a fast-paced and team-driven environment.

Your role includes the following:
• Lead a team of product managers and provide guidance, coaching, and mentorship to help them achieve their goals and deliver high-quality products in our core marketplace
• Together with your PMs, authoring and reviewing strategic documents in a-synchronous discussions
• Stewarding big strategic opportunities across different teams, including driving an inspiring vision and coordinating required work across adjacent teams
• Aligning team contributions and product solutions to the company strategy
• Together with your peers in Engineering (Engineering Manager) and UX (UX Manager) ensuring that your teams can turn that strategy into a concrete product roadmap and execute on it
• Work closely with business, operations and marketing stakeholders to identify opportunities that can drive revenue growth and improve customer experience.
• Report on core metrics in the dynamic marketplace
• Together with your product peers evangelize an evidence-based and experiment-driven culture in our product development department
• Multi-year experience in working in product management for customer facing products
• 7+ years of experience in product management
• 3+ years of experience leading and managing product managers
• Experience in two-sided marketplaces, ideally B2B2C with deep understanding of marketplace dynamics
• Proven track record in delivering customer value which drives growth
• Attention to detail and ability to switch from the managerial plane to stepping in when needed
• Experience working in an Agile development environment.
• Strong problem-solving skills and ability to navigate complex technical challenges.
• Strong communicator able to translate complex metrics and dynamics into comprehensible story-telling
• Strong interpersonal and communication skills in English, both in written and oral form; which enables you to work well in our distributed and hybrid organisational setup with emphasis on a-synchronous information flows

Why you’ll enjoy working at the Instapro Group

You can make an Impact. Joining Instapro Group is an opportunity to help crack the code in one of the last big industries to become digital-first. We’re leaders in our markets, yet small enough for everyone to make a real difference.

We care. We don’t believe in one size fits all. Whether it’s flexibility in your working hours, your location, or opportunities to advance and grow, you’ll find a supportive and open culture designed to help our team members thrive.

These are the benefits you'll enjoy:
• 33 days holiday (including bank holidays) + 1 annual bonus leave day after 5, 8, 10, 15 and 20 work anniversaries (capped at 5 bonus leave days)
• 5% employer pension contribution
• Eligibility to receive stock appreciation rights
• Comprehensive private medical insurance with AXA
• Routine treatments health cash plan
• Enhanced parental leave
• Hybrid work environment
• Training support
• Generous hybrid allowance
• Commuting allowance for office days

These are the values that guide everything we do:
• We put integrity first. We are authentic, transparent and respectful.
• We are all stewards. We are stewards of the company on behalf of all stakeholders.
• We follow the evidence. We are objective, evidence-based and pragmatic in our decision-making.
• We never stop learning. We are open-minded and curious.
• We win together. We collaborate and earn trust with our colleagues.
• We are inclusive. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive company.

Read our values in full here
