title: AI Ethical Innovation Product Manager
description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

The Opportunity:

From the moment you wake up in the morning until you go to bed at night consider the media you consume, the adverts you see, the apps you use, the websites you browse and almost all of the shopping you do online throughout the day. Chances are that every single one of those interactions, every... single one of those experiences, was touched by an Adobe product.

Adobe’s Office of Ethical Innovation (AI Ethics) drives organization-wide ethics related activities and develops processes, tools, training, and other resources that guide our AI solutions to consistently reflect Adobe’s AI ethics principles: accountability, responsibility, and transparency. AI is essential to our Adobe products, and we continue to see AI used in more innovative ways. AI Ethics needs to be top of mind from research to product release.

What you'll Do:
• Work closely with product teams to help identify and evaluate potential harmful bias in technologies such as Big Data, Natural Language Processing, Deep Learning, Classification, GANS, and Generative AI.
• Research, evaluate, and propose harmful bias mitigation techniques for product teams.
• Prototype evaluation techniques for AI product use cases.
• Assist product teams in designing and performing harmful bias evaluations as needed, including developing test suites and metrics and adapting them.
• Create and maintain reusable test suites and benchmarks to work across several AI use cases across business domains.
• Review, analyze, and evaluate global AI legislative and regulatory developments and their impact on product and product development.
• Develop internal processes, guidelines, and policies to support successful operationalization of the AI Ethics principles across the organization.

What you need to succeed:

You’re a creative problem solver who loves to explore and uncover issues. You are joining a fast-paced organization that often requires quick turnarounds, so initiative and efficiency is needed for success in this position.

In terms of specifics:
• Bachelor’s degree in STEM, social science, economics, data science, computer engineering, computer science; graduate or higher degree with research or coursework related to AI ethics; or equivalent practical experience.
• Proven relevant work experience in AI and/or Machine Learning Lifecycle, AI product lifecycle, evaluation design and human computer interaction, especially regarding ethical considerations in AI and ML (Machine Learning).
• Knowledge of statistical modelling or data analytics concepts.
• Experience in programming languages such as Python, MatLab, or R.
• Strong analytical and quantitative problem-solving ability.
• Strong written and oral communication skills and social skills.
• Flexible and adaptable, able to work in ambiguous situations.

As our many awards will tell you, at Adobe you’ll be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized around the world. You’ll be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog, https://blog.adobe.com/en/topics/adobe-life and explore the fantastic benefits we offer at Rewards.adobe.com.

Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We hire talented individuals, regardless of gender, race or colour, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We know that when our employees feel appreciated and included, they can be more creative, innovative and successful. This is what it means to be Adobe For All.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours.

Adobe is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate based on gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law. Learn more.

Adobe aims to make Adobe.com accessible to any and all users. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation to navigate our website or complete the application process, email accommodations@adobe.com or call (408) 536-3015.

Adobe values a free and open marketplace for all employees and has policies in place to ensure that we do not enter into illegal agreements with other companies to not recruit or hire each other’s employees

title: Global Product Director – Meetings & Events
description:
WHAT YOU'LL DO

Enterprise Services is a global team of experts and operational leaders managing a diverse set of functional areas serving BCGers worldwide. These are business critical functions with significant influence on our employee experience. Our internal clients within BCG are generally BCG’s offices, systems, and regions; its Practice Areas; and other internal BCG functions such as... Marketing, Learning & Development, and Finance.

BCG has a Meetings & Events portfolio of over 250 events annually spanning in-person, hybrid, and virtual experiences. Our Meetings & Events team within Enterprise Services works closely with BCG’s senior leaders to plan and manage BCG’s event programs, always with a focus on sustainability, attendee experience, and technology innovation. Transforming the digital products supporting our processes is a critical enabler of success. This is a dynamic environment, and as such the Product Owner will be crucial in helping to define the digitally-enabled future of Meetings & Events at BCG.

To help execute this transformation, we need a Product Owner that will lead our Meetings & Events digital product squad in setting, prioritizing, and evaluating the work generated by the Squad to ensure a best-in-class sustainable experience. The Product Owner will take end-to-end ownership of Squad goals, set product roadmap and vision, and drive value realization by translating the internal client voice and needs into product features. These products include a combination of SaaS solutions and custom applications.

Working with Squad members without line management authority over them will be key—you are a servant-leader and embody that in how you approach the work. You will coordinate closely with your Portfolio Lead to stay aligned on business goals and make sure your Squad is progressing and delivering against them. You will also represent the voice of the internal client and make sure that Squad members understand their needs and preferences. To get this work done, you will own and prioritize the backlog of user stories that your Squad members will use to inform their work, and be responsible for supporting and motivating your squad members.

Among your responsibilities, you will:

Deliver business results and customer value
• Ensure that the product is built in an incremental way, releasing new working features at the end of each sprint and creating value for the customer
• Tracking product performance to inform future work
• Delivering on specific and measurable KPIs to be defined for your Squad
• Managing relevant product budget process and supporting Tribe Lead in engaging with funding process
Serve as the voice of the internal client
• Translating the voice and needs of internal clients into user stories, engaging users as needed
• Engaging in continuous discovery (e.g., via surveys & interviews) to understand internal client needs
• Leveraging empirical and qualitative data to assess feature performance and inform prioritization
• Determining tradeoffs involving customer value, cost, and speed to execution
• Representing customer needs to ensure they are understood and integrated into the Squad’s work
• Proactively seeking customer feedback to learn and better understand their needs and requirements
• Facilitating product demos to empower Squad members with real-time feedback from customers
Oversee what is delivered by the Squad and when
• Prioritizing work through a well-organized backlog of user stories and clearly communicating what needs to be done and by when
• Defining and clearly communicating acceptance criteria for output based on business & customer needs
Support and enable the Squad to get its work done
• Regularly engaging with the Squad to offer feedback on work-in-progress and clarify requirements
• Engaging with Chapter Leads regarding resourcing and functional expertise required in Squad
• Providing feedback as part of performance management of Squad members and other members of the Tribe
Set an overall vision to direct and inform the Squad’s work
• Working closely with the Tribe Lead to understand and drive alignment on the Tribe’s business strategy, goals, and objectives
• Translating Tribe objectives into a clear vision (e.g., via KPIs, sprint goals) for your Squad to inform the creation and prioritization of the Squad's backlog of work
• Sharing information about the Squad’s output and priorities with other Product Owners to ensure alignment across the organization
Enable the organization’s new way of working
• Modelling behaviors to support the organization’s transformation to a new way of working
• Actively creating and maintaining a Squad culture based on the organization and Agile behaviors
• Providing informal and formal feedback within context of larger performance management system

YOU'RE GOOD AT
• Being customer-focused and dedicated to understanding and learning about customer needs and requirements
• Operating with a transparency mindset, communicating clearly and openly both above and below
• Being comfortable leading, directing, and empowering team members without formal management authority
• Working with ambiguous requirements and multi-disciplinary teams
• Influencing stakeholders up to the senior levels of the organization
• Bringing a data-driven approach to decision making, both in day-to-day management and in making strategic trade-offs
• Looking for opportunities to innovate and get things done better and faster

YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)
• 7+ years’ relevant experience in Agile organizations and/or in the Meetings & Events industry
• A passion for Meetings & Events and hospitality services in general
• Understanding of agile principles and ways of working
• Understanding of technology enabled business transformation, Digital transformation, Organizational transformation, and delivering enterprise-level IT and Digital projects
• Divergent thinker who can converge ideas into tangible products
• Exceptional communications and stakeholder management skills
• Experience in consulting is a plus

YOU'LL WORK WITH
• Every member of your squad, for which you will be its servant leader
• Internal clients, translating their voice and needs into user stories and engaging users as needed
• Product Portfolio Lead who will set the vision, roadmap, budget, and priorities & OKRs for the tribes and subsequently, for the squads
• Scrum Masters, which will act as your right hand to remove impediments and will assess you in dealing with the different artifacts and ceremonies
• Other Product Owners within BCG, to share best practices and ensure alignment between squads and a culture
• Agile Coaches, with whom you will share passion about Agile ways of working and with whom you will shape promote business agility (within your teams and in the whole company)
• Chapter Leads and Tech Area Leaders for technical solutioning and delivery

title: Product Manager (Search and Observability)
description:
Requirements
• Master’s degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related academic field,
• 5 years of experience in the field of Product Management, Software Development, Distributed Systems, or any combination thereof to include all job titles within the occupation,
• Employer will accept a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related academic field and 7 years of progressive experience in the field of Product Management, Software Development, Distributed Systems, or any combination thereof to include all job titles within the occupation in lieu of a Master’s degree and 5 years of experience,
• Work experience to include:,
• 5 years of experience as a product manager building,
• Enterprise software products,
• 3 years of experience with backend development in,
• Distributed systems,
• 3 years of experience with user experience and usability,
• 3 years of experience in data analysis for large-scale systems... telemetry,
• Building SAAS products with a global user base,
• Building product marketing plans to communicate business value of the product to the customer,
• Designing and analyzing experiments to make data-driven decisions,
• Running A/B tests for product features to validate product hypotheses,
• Converting system metrics to developer insights,
• Working with sales and marketing teams to create and execute go-to-market plans,
• Working with sales enablement, customer success, and sales teams to perform product demos to enterprise customers,
• Working with customer success teams to triage customer issues and incidents to provide a resolution,
• Any and all experience may be gained concurrently

What the job involves
• Develop the company’s product strategy for search and observability product features,
• Define and improve the company’s key funnels and metrics, write product specs, and drive cross-functional execution while providing product recommendations,
• Conduct end-to-end roadmaps for multiple, bi-weekly planned releases, and unplanned hotfix releases,
• Provide in-depth understanding of the company’s product features and dependencies in order to make technical recommendations with the engineering team and complex computer science ideas into simple experiences for customers,
• Build and design dashboards, datasets, and products with a global user base and accurately measure experiments,
• Partner with enterprise customers to create intuitive and simplified search and observability product features and workflows

title: Product Manager
description:
Rithum™ is the world’s most trusted commerce network, accelerating how brands, suppliers, and retailers work together to deliver seamless e-commerce experiences. We provide an unmatched platform for brands and retailers, enabling them to accelerate growth, optimise operations across channels, scale product offerings and enhance margins.

Today, more than 40,000 companies trust Rithum to grow their business across hundreds of channels, representing over $50 billion in annual GMV. Using our commerce, marketing, and delivery solutions, our customers create optimised consumer shopping journeys from beginning to end.

Overview

Our Product Manager will collaborate with engineering, design, marketing, and sales teams to serve our customers, the leading retailers, brands, and suppliers. The ideal candidate is a strategic thinker with a passion for product and a knack for distilling technical concepts to non-technical audiences.

Responsibilities
• Triage incoming client requests and assigned... projects, ensuring timely and articulate responses, and follow through to release.
• Collaborate with the engineering and UX team to prioritize client requests, balancing urgency and resource availability.
• Act as a liaison between the engineering team, other internal teams, and clients to facilitate clear communication and understanding of product features and developments.
• Engage in product validation and Quality Assurance (Q&A) to ensure the highest standards of product functionality and user experience.
• Oversee documentation processes for product changes and updates.
• Manage product release cycles, coordinating between teams to ensure smooth rollouts and client transitions.

Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications
• 3+ years of experience as a product manager at a SAAS company
• Ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
• Ability to work in fast-paced environments and manage multiple projects simultaneously.

Preferred Qualifications
• Intrapreneurial with a founder mindset.
• Experience working on a global product management team.

What it’s like to work at Rithum

When you join Rithum, you can expect to work with smart risk-takers, courageous collaborators, and curious minds.

As part of the Rithum team, you are valued, supported, and included. Guided by a transparent culture and accessible, approachable leadership, we offer career opportunities aligned to your ambitions and talents. To ensure work and life balance works for you, we also offer an array of resources to support you and your families, including comprehensive benefits and wellness plans.

At Rithum you will:
• Partner with the leading brands and retailers.
• Connect with passionate professionals who will help support your goals.
• Participate in an inclusive, welcoming work atmosphere.
• Achieve work-life balance through remote-first working conditions, generous time off, and wellness days.
• Receive industry-competitive compensation and total rewards benefits.

Benefits
• Enhanced Private Medical Insurance and a Health Cash Back Plan
• Life insurance & disability benefits
• Pension plan with 4% Company match
• Competitive time off package with 25 Days of PTO, 8 Holidays, 2 Wellness days and 1 Give Back Day
• Flexibility to choose where you work - at home, in the office, or both!
• Access to tools to support your wellbeing such as the Calm App, MoveSpring and an Employee Assistance Program
• Professional development stipend and learning and development offerings to help you build the skills and connections you need to move forward in your career
• Charitable contribution match per team member

Rithum is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates without regard to race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need

title: Senior Product Manager
description:
Back Market is the world’s leading refurbished electronics marketplace with a team of 650 people, powering operations in 21 countries (and counting!).

Named one of the World's Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company in 2019 and again in 2021, our mission is simple: empowering people to consume tech sustainably by offering folks a high quality, accessible, and more eco-friendly alternative to buying new electronics. Why? Refurbished tech helps lower our collective environmental impact. We have indeed contributed to avoid the production of more than 1,000,000 tons of CO2e worldwide since our launch in 2014.

Be part of an exciting and growing international adventure that will change the way the world consumes tech.

About the Job

We are hiring a Senior Product Manager to create the future of Back Market's relationship with customers by discovering new opportunities and optimising what we have from supporting device sales (smartphones, laptops, desktops, consoles, accessories, etc... services attachment (insurance, mobile plans…), and circularity (trade-in and more to come). You’ll be the squad leader and collaborate with our business teams, engineers, product designers, and researchers.
The customer journey web & app is our storefront to millions of users globally. It is central to the company strategy to evangelize ‘refurbished tech’ and circular economy for electronic devices. The Back Market product scope is very wide, so it’s an opportunity to shape a better future and significantly impact millions of people. And eventually to help the world make more of what we already have!
This will require a deep understanding of the refurbished space and our customers needs. You will be surrounded by experts who will support you in rethinking the future of the customer experience in our different countries from Europe to the US and APAC.

The hiring process is in 4 rounds:
- Recruiter interview,
- Product interview with live case study,
- Business/Engineering stakeholders interview,
- Cultural fit.
Your mission (if you accept it):
• You lead your squad’s vision by gathering strategic inputs and insights, synthesizing them into a compelling vision, and embarking to everyone with you.
• You are also responsible for defining your Northstar metric and KPIs: it drives the team toward concrete goals and impacts.
• You build strong roadmaps that embody the company strategy and consider the great other initiatives in the company.
• You are the entry point for all stakeholders to understand the short and long-term priorities, and you liaise with them to ensure your product fits perfectly into the Back Market experience (Services teams, Money journey teams, Operations with Logistics, Circularity, and Care teams, Legal, etc.).
• You are in charge of defining the most impactful iteration: you approach it methodically, balancing data centricity and emotional bonds that are at the heart of loved products.
• You can translate data into actionable insights.
• You communicate clearly and regularly on the risks and impacts of your roadmap and features: you know how to anticipate problems and dependencies to ensure a smooth delivery.
• The product management skills have no secret for you: you master the discovery steps (link with research, design, data), as well as delivery (testing and QA are part of the game!).
• You are the Engineering Manager's daily partner: you adjust priorities if needed, and your communication skills and ability to collaborate with engineers ensure our quality standards and commitments are met.
• Data is your best friend: data drives your decisions and vision… You never work without data!
You are in the right place if:
• You are fluent in English (multicultural teams)
• You have strong Product Manager experience 5/7+ years for senior/staff, ideally on a customer-facing side
• You have a proven track record of product vision (creating successful product vision)
• You have a strong business maturity, you understand the company challenges that come at each phase of growth, including the acquisition channels.
• You master soft skills like leadership, negotiation, and communication. This is highly appreciated by your stakeholders, who feel heard and engaged in your vision and operational activities. You have experience with facilitating difficult trade-offs and rallying people around a common plan
• You have product management experience in an agile environment (Scrum, Kanban, etc.) and you can shape product discovery and delivery according to agile principles. You are skilled with Product Designers, UX researchers, and Engineering teams & comfortable working with multiple strategic stakeholders
• You have a problem-solver attitude, comfortable navigating ambiguous situations using data and putting the user at the center of all your thoughts.
• You are driven by impact, fluent with data, and have a proven track record of measuring your impact thanks to A/B tests.
• You are a team player and know how to use soft power to embark people with you.
WHY SHOULD YOU JOIN US ? ✌🏼

- A meaningful job: you will help avoid thousands of tons of electronic waste and fight against planned obsolescence. It counts!
- A meaningful company: we became a mission-driven company in January 2022.
- Be part of a worldwide growing company based in Europe, the USA and Asia to face great challenges : you will have the freedom to innovate and adopt new ideas!
- Work alongside passionate experts: who will share their knowledge and help you develop and grow in your career.
- Grow your career: with a flexible career path and a dedicated Learning & Development team. Back Market will help you evolve with personalized internal trainings and external handpicked providers from day 1!
- Leadership Academy by Back Market:“be a coach not a dictator” is at the core of this program ! We train and enable all our leaders to support their team towards achieving goals. Be a manager at Back Market is an unique experience we take by heart.
- An attractive salary, equity and a host of benefits including : Lunch voucher, health insurance, relocation package, paid time off for activism in your community, parental benefits, flexible hours, etc…
- Remote friendly company : up to 3 days of remote work per week!
- One Loving Tribe: you will have the opportunity to work in a fast-paced, open-minded and friendly environment.
- Be part of one of our Employee Resource Groups createdaround shared identities, common backgrounds and/or special interests crafted to be a safe space and an expressive outlet.
- Several internal events: The Monday Brief (weekly)/ The Somehands (monthly)/ The All Hands (annual).
- We’re here to SABOTAGE: It’s our mantra. It keeps us focused on what we aspire to be: a little bit sneaky, always smart, kinda frugal and constantly conspiring to create maximum impact.

Back Market is an Equal Opportunity Employer which means we pledge to not discriminate against employees based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetic information.. If reasonable accommodations are needed for the interview process, please do not hesitate to discuss this with the Talent Acquisition Team.

Back Market is helping to address one of the biggest challenges of our time: climate change. We take this so seriously that we were awarded status as a “Société à Mission”, or company with a social mission, by the French government. We know we can’t tackle a global problem without a globally representative team so we are committed to embedding diversity, equity and inclusion principles in every aspect of our organization. But more importantly, being One Loving & Free Spirited Tribe is in our DNA as it is one of the five foundational values of our company since we got started way back in 2014. We are committed to hiring and supporting diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We know our lofty goals cannot be reached unless everyone has a seat at the table along with the resources and opportunity to grow

title: Product Development Manager (A2A)
description:
Job Title:

Product Development Manager (A2A)

Overview:

Overview:
Manager, Product Development - Foundry

Who is Mastercard?
Mastercard is a global technology company in the payments industry. Our mission is to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart, and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments, and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. With connections across more than 210 countries and territories, we are building a sustainable world that unlocks priceless possibilities for all.

Overview
Mastercard Foundry is the innovation engine of Mastercard and a hub for new product development. We do this by driving product innovation in emerging technologies and interfaces while focusing on... developing a point of view to enhance existing solutions and new use-cases. We also focus on building revenue generating ecosystems and flywheels that can be standalone in adjacent segments and markets. Examples of focus areas include commercial payments, new payment flows, real time payments, data and services.

Within Foundry, the Manager, Product Development will be supporting the execution of new to market product development in A2A space. Role responsibility including identification, execution, and in-market delivery of new products and solutions. The responsibilities will include execution of near-term opportunities that drive significant in year revenue and strategic differentiation for Mastercard, as well as scoping, identification, in-market testing of longer-term product concepts and solutions
Role:
• Engage in idea generation for new to market A2A products and solutions including workshop facilitation and collateral development.
• Contribute to developing product concepts and prototypes and independently own and deliver key tasks associated with it.
• Partner with Product & Engineering partners and our CX&D team on concept validation and market testing and independently own and deliver key tasks associated with it.
• Contribute / own business case development and planning for individual products.
• Own and deliver high quality collateral materials to facilitate internal decision making.
• Lead cross functional workshops and manage follow up actions to completion.
• Partner with R&D teams by providing prioritized requirements.
• Review and provide feedback on R&D deliverables.

All About You

• In depth understanding of commercial payment ecosystem and expanding role of A2A and real time payments globally.

• Previous experience working in Payments innovation space delivering new to market value propositions.
• Strong product development experience, including rapid opportunity identification, concept development, business model innovation, and in market testing of global products.
• Technical expertise, and experience working with R&D teams
• Flair in connecting people and ideas; ability to operate in a matrix environment

title: Product Manager (Retail)
description:
As Product Manager (Retail) at Publicis Sapient, you will act as your clients’ trusted advisor in leading the overall business solution, vision, strategy, roadmap, and prioritisation for a specific digital product, or products, within an engagement. You will collaborate with our clients in the Retail industry undertaking major Digital Business Transformation (DBT) engagements to understand their business, end-customer needs, and then constantly deliver value with fast increment cycles.

Your Impact
• Partner with client(s), strategists, experience leads, and enterprise architects, to frame business goals and value streams from which we can shape solution propositions that provide transformative business outcomes and customer experience
• Develop large solution vision that aligns with the product vision, strategy, and industry compliance, by keeping customer at the center of everything we do while using design thinking tools
• Represent client while facilitating solution workshops with... cross functional leaders where you identify new solution, organisation business needs, and solution options
• Develop solution hypotheses iteratively based on user research, and industry and market trend analysis
• Translate solution vision into a product vision/roadmap containing well-defined, prioritised features that will realise the solution and value
• Validate and present the business case to C–level executives and lead business reviews to ensure the team prioritises the right features
• Serve as a voice of the customer among the cross-functional team, always understanding and representing the customer needs
• Establish objective goals for the product with success and acceptance criteria using meaningful metrics, KPIs, and quantifiable business outcomes
• Masterfully apply Lean Agile practices and frameworks
• Collaborate with product managers, other solution managers, and cross-functional capability managers to ensure all product teams, to ensure alignment towards the same programme increment (PI) objectives
• Collaborate with enterprise architects to envision and prioritise capability enablers
• Represent industry best practice and market trends to assist the client in maintaining competitive advantage
• Build and maintain a trusting relationship with the client, teams, and vendors; develop influence without authority
• Inspire, lead, and mentor, a high-performing team of Product Analysts to continually facilitate improvements in developing and enhancing best-in-class digital products and services

title: Product Manager
description:
Are you an experienced Product Manager with extensive knowledge of the European travel market? Do you have a passion for Adventure Travel? Well, we may just have the perfect role for you!

Our Exodus Product team is the hub of the business. Our dual goals are to deliver the best customer on-trip experience, alongside maximum volume and margin for each product we operate. We do this through the choice and management of a global network of quality overseas suppliers. The Product Manager's remit is to innovate, develop, plan and deliver the trips in their region. This role will manage up to 40 products and their suppliers (normally between 15 and 25 different suppliers)

About us

Our mission is simple, to Improve life through travel. Exodus Travels is one of the world’s leading adventure travel companies delivering extraordinary traveling experiences across more than 90 countries worldwide. Providing unparalleled expertise and local knowledge, our exceptional guides on the ground and... teams in our worldwide offices have been crafting amazing travel experiences for years. Our values are to Bring Happiness, Take Responsibility, Be Ambitious and Always Passionate, they underpin the work that we do and act as a reminder of why we do it. We are looking for people who can embrace our values and live them every day.

What you will be doing:
• New Product Development, in conjunction with our senior product managers to ensure the best outcome
• Analyse customer and competitor data to develop a unique, and commercially profitable regional portfolio and strategy
• Work with your manager to identify procurement and contracting targets for coming year
• Negotiate with your local operator suppliers to ensure we have the most competitive rates & commercial terms
• Manage a positive and constructive relationship with our local operators throughout the contracting and operational cycle
• To produce inspiring, quality and accurate trip descriptions, which improve sales and ensure customer expectations are met or exceeded
• Work with overseas suppliers, customer services, operational quality, sustainability staff and to ensure the products under your responsibility operate to the highest appropriate standards of quality, sustainability and safety

What we are looking for:
• A commercially minded, experienced product manager with a travel or tour operator background
• Extensive knowledge of the European travel market
• Demonstrate excellent attention to detail, along with strong analytical and commercial skills to optimise product performance
• Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, with a friendly and professional manner and ability to build great relationships
• An understanding or experience in outdoor or adventurous activities such as trekking, walking or cycling
• IT literate, especially in Excel, PowerPoint, and Word
• A positive culture champion, who is energetic and supportive of continuous improvement

Join us and in return you will be rewarded with:
• Competitive salary + bonus scheme
• 33 days annual leave that increases with length of service (including bank holidays & Educational travel)
• An enhanced employer contribution pension scheme
• Exciting travel opportunities
• Hybrid working (1-2 days in the office)

Our commitment to equity, diversity & inclusion

We believe people are happier and perform best when they are able to be their true self, and that diverse teams deliver better results. Together we will cultivate a diverse, equitable and inclusive environment, where everyone can flourish.

We are committed to inspiring change through increasing awareness of, and counteracting, unconscious bias; building an inclusive culture, and embracing diversity in all its dimensions.

Travelopia is committed to ensuring a work environment that is open, accessible, and inclusive, removing barriers for all individuals. If you require accommodations/additional support to participate in the recruitment and selection process, kindly inform us. Our hiring team will work with you to provide suitable accommodations/additional in a timely and confidential manner. Information received will be handled with the utmost discretion.

To request accommodations, please contact our team at Talent@Travelopia.com

If you’re looking for your next adventure and want to play a key role in the delivery of our Exodus experiences, then we would love to hear from you!

#LI-SR1 #LI-HYBRID

title: Product Manager
description:
ABOUT PLEDGE

Pledge empowers transport and logistics leaders to reach their sustainability goals through its accredited and integrated software. With a focus on accessibility and transparency, Pledge allows users to start measuring, reducing and removing their carbon emissions in minutes with its self-serve product, giving customers the confidence they need to take credible and impactful climate action in logistics supply chains.

Founded by early Revolut employees, David de Picciotto and Thomas Lucas, and Freetrade’s co-founder and former CTO, André Mohamed, Pledge's team draws on its experience building scalable businesses in the regulated and complex payments and capital markets industries and applies it to help decarbonise some of the highest emitting industries on the planet.

Pledge recently secured $10 million in Series A funding to continue building best-in-class products to drive its mission to help businesses reach net zero emissions.

ABOUT THE ROLE

As Pledge’s first... product hire you'll play a defining role in the strategy and roadmap of our products. You'll work in close collaboration with the founders, product design, engineering, business development and other internal and external stakeholders.

Pledge works with B2B customers across a range of sectors including logistics, travel, e-commerce and fintech amongst others. The role will entail building a deep understanding of our business and our customers’ needs in order to build and ship products that people will love to use and will contribute to the success of the business and the mission.

WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING
• Coordinate and help define product strategy and roadmap, drive product releases
• Work closely as part of a cross-functional team of product designers, engineers and other stakeholders to define, prioritize and ship product features
• Identify and fill product gaps, solicit and capture new ideas that improve customer experience and drive growth and engagement
• Coordinate with all stakeholders on the delivery of the backlog and product releases

WHAT YOU'LL NEED
• 3 to 8+ years of experience as a product manager successfully shipping SaaS products
• B.S/M.S in Operations Research, Economics, Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, Computer science or other quantitative related fields
• Experience working in an agile cross-functional product team, ideally building B2B SaaS products
• Strong understanding of all aspects of an agile product development lifecycle, including product strategy development, story writing and requirements definition, backlog prioritisation, development, QA and launch
• Strong analytical skills and strategic thinking with an ability to work in a fast-paced environment
• A consultative mindset of listening, understanding and anticipating customer and partner needs and finding simple solutions out of complex use cases
• An ability to work with data, ideally SQL or other analytics tools, to make data-driven decisions
• Experience building a team as well as managing and mentoring team members and/or external contractors and freelancers

WHAT WILL MAKE YOU SUCCESSFUL
• You share Pledge’s mission to enable businesses to take action on their climate impact
• You can work autonomously and take ownership with a high degree of integrity
• You operate best without lots of bureaucracy
• You have an obsession for solving customer problems and get excited about spending time with users of your products
• You approach work in a logical way and operate from first principles

BENEFITS
• Generous stock options - we are all owners of Pledge
• Competitive salary
• 25 days holiday (excl. bank holidays) increasing by 1 day each year of employment
• Pension plan
• Private health insurance (You’ll have full access to private online GP appointments, mental health support, and a Care Hub)
• Cycle to work scheme
• Regular team socials

title: (Senior) Fintech Product Manager
description:
About Us

We are TravelPerk: a scaling unicorn valued at $1.3 billion that has raised over $400m since our creation in 2015.

Backed by world-class investors with portfolios including Airbnb, Stripe, Slack, Trello, Gusto, Twitter, Farfetch and Deliveroo, our team comprises A-players from the travel and technology industries.

We’ve been named the fastest-growing SaaS startup in the world by SaaS1000 and featured as one of the hottest startups to watch by both Forbes and Wired. We’re revolutionizing the B2B corporate travel market—worth over $1.3 trillion— to connect people in real life in an enjoyable and sustainable way.

TravelPerk is an innovator. We have welcomed and acquired the likes of Click Travel, NexTravel and Albatross to the team. From TravelCare, to FlexiPerk and GreenPerk, we are shaping the industry's future. Our team continues to emerge stronger and stronger as we adjust to the new normal—and that’s where you come in! If you’re ready to take off with us, keep... reading!

The Role

At TravelPerk, we believe in empowering cross-functional teams of talented individuals who are accountable for and dedicated to delivering exceptional results for our customers and the company. As a Product Manager, you will be the architect of value creation by working with stakeholders, customers, and your team to identify opportunities, translate them into a product strategy, and then oversee the execution of the work, iteratively testing hypotheses and correcting course to achieve your goals.

The Pay Tribe is TravelPerk’s in-house fintech: we look after the complex infrastructure that enables millions of dollars to be transacted on our platform every day, everywhere in the world, as well as providing the tools to help both our customers and internal teams deal with money and automate accounting processes with a high level of reliability, security and accuracy.

We are looking for a Product Manager for our Accounting Automation team, to build AI-powered products and services to help finance teams make sense of travel spend, match invoices and payments, sync data between expense management and accounting platforms, and claim back VAT on travel expenses. You will be the owner of one of TravelPerk’s key value propositions, directly impacting finance teams, frequently the ultimate decision-makers in spending millions of dollars with TravelPerk.

What you'll do
• Insight generation: Using quantitative and qualitative insight generation to understand the biggest opportunities for impact, sharing these with stakeholders and turning them into strategies
• Articulate and communicate the context and vision for your product areas, in a way which motivates your teams and brings clarity to your stakeholders.
• Define strategies that communicate why a problem needs tackling, how it is going to be tackled and the metrics used to judge impact.
• Work closely with internal teams, including developers, designers, and operations, to execute your strategy at speed and incrementally deliver value.
• Answer incoming questions about your area of the product and provide relevant training, including facilitating the creation and maintenance of proper product documentation.
• You’ll practice a servant-leadership style to help your teams achieve a high-performing state. You’ll shield the makers from external distractions and optimise their environment and ways of working for enhanced velocity, impact, product mindset and a great culture.
• Help us grow a 7-star product organisation. You’ll constantly be learning to develop your personal craft, and to uncover (and spread) new ideas and inspiration among your colleagues.
• You’ll also mentor and train fellow product managers and associates. You may also take on line management responsibilities for a small group of PMs.

What will you need to succeed?

We need someone who has a proven track record of bringing incredible products to life with a data-driven and user-centric approach. Your background will include:
• A proven track record of 5+ years at an Internet-based company, with at least 2 years as a Product Manager. Web development experience is valued but not a necessity.
• Comfortable with concepts related to finance and tax, and demonstrated ability to work with finance stakeholders.
• Great understanding of how to build software products with a demonstrated ability to break down complex projects into smaller milestones adding incremental value.
• Demonstrated ability to learn multiple functional areas of business – engineering, design, finance, or data..
• Demonstrated ability to figure out solutions to hard problems with many constraints, using sound judgement to assess risks, and to lay out your proposal in a well-structured, data-informed, written narrative.
• Proven ability to engage with Engineers, Data/Data Science, Customer Support, Legal, Finance/Accounting and other key stakeholders.

What we offer
• A competitive compensation package, including equity in TravelPerk (amount depends on role)
• 25 days annual leave plus bank holidays
• Private medical insurance from Bupa
• Life insurance with Zurich
• Access to voluntary Dental Insurance through Bupa
• Discounts on 12-month gym memberships with GymFlex
• Free access to iFeel - a wellbeing app with wellbeing resources, online chats with therapists and access to 16 face to face video sessions with a therapist a year
• 16 paid hours per year to volunteer for a cause of your choice.
• A ’Work from anywhere’ in the world allowance of 20 working days per year.
• Free access to Udemy for Business to support development and growth
• Opportunity to invest in the TK Share Plan
• Access to a wide variety of discounts and rewards
• Unforgettable TravelPerk events including our spectacular annual summer party

How we work

Our Vision is for a world where TravelPerk serves as the platform for human connection in-real-life (IRL). We take an IRL-first approach to work, where our team works together in-person 3 days a week. As such, this role requires you to be based within commuting distance of our HUB NAME hub. We fundamentally believe in the value of meeting in-real-life to improve connectivity, productivity, creativity and ultimately making us a great place to work.

Please submit your resume in English if you choose to apply. Remember to submit an updated portfolio and resume. Note that we will decide of your exact levelling during the interviewing process.

TravelPerk is a global company with a diverse customer base—and we want to ensure the people behind our product reflect that. We’re an equal opportunity employer, meaning you’re welcome at TravelPerk regardless of your appearance, where you’re from, or anything else that makes you
