title: Product Manager, Current Account
description:
Our Story

Hello there. We’re Zopa.

We started our journey back in 2005, building the first ever peer-to-peer lending company. Fast forward to 2020 and we launched Zopa Bank. A bank that listens to what our customers don’t like about finance and does the opposite. We’re redefining what it feels like to work in finance. Our vision for a new era of banking puts people front and centre — we’ve built a business that empowers everyone to aim high, every day, to move finance forward. Find out more about our fantastic offerings at Zopa.com!

We’re incredibly proud of our achievements and none of it would be possible without the amazing team here. It’s not just industry awards we’re winning, we’ve also been named in the top three UK’s Most Loved Workplaces.

If you embrace unconventional challenges, are unafraid to think differently and are driven to make an outsized impact, you’ll thrive here at Zopa, so join us, and make it count. Want to see us in action? Follow us on Instagram... @zopalife

We are moving into Current Accounts and are looking for a Product Manager to help us to shape and build out the customer experience and features.

We want to transform the Current Accounts space as we have already done with loans, savings, credit cards and car finance, tying together our Zopa ecosystem, with big ambitions targeting over 1m+ active customers in 3 years time. This role will be crucial to helping us get there so there's big opportunity for some serious career defining impact.

The Current Account tribe will be split over multiple squads, however at the centre of the product is the Current Account Experiences team which this Product Manager will lead and play a key role in building out.

This is a highly autonomous and high ownership role, strategising how we design and build the main customer experiences of Current Accounts (think how you apply for an account, your main dashboard, and making transfers). 

Of course, you won't be doing this alone! Collaboration is in our Zopa DNA which means you'll be part of a cross-functional squad of talented and passionate engineers, designers and QA working together from concept through to delivery. There’s no room for ivory tower thinking and dishing out requirements - you’ll need to work proactively and collaboratively from the ground up, engaging stakeholders and getting their buy in and most importantly making sure we're building the right things.

This is an opportunity that can give a lot of scope to supercharge your career within a fast-scaling FinTech that is looking to IPO soon. If this challenge excites you, we'd love to hear from you!

A day in the life
• Work closely with the Senior Product Designer to create the central Current Account customer experience and features for launch
• Work with the engineers in your team to work out how to build the product, helping them make the right trade-offs to ensure a speedy delivery
• With the help of the engineers and designers in your team, ensure everything built is beautiful, valuable, viable, usable and feasible
• Help us make key commercial partnership decisions, e.g. what card issuer to use, and lend your commercial and technical acumen toward making those calls
• Have an eye on the bigger picture. All roads will lead to your squad, so you’ll need to be involved in the work of Current Account platform and operational teams
• Build close relationships with key stakeholders such as Operations, Compliance, Brand, Legal and Finance to effectively and collaboratively solve problems
• Work closely with the Current Account Product Lead on over-arching product strategy for customer acquisition

About you...
• You have strong experience working in a customer facing product environment. Ideally, you have experience at a Fintech, but this isn’t imperative!
• You are an experienced Product Manager and are excited by the journey we’re on
• You can point to the products you’ve built and the success that they’ve had. If you haven’t created a zero to one product, you can point to metrics you’ve worked to really move the needle on forprevious products
• You'recustomer orientated – you know full well that if customers don’t love your product it won’t be a success long term. You’re comfortable combining quantitative and qualitative evidence to bring customer insights into your decision-making process. And,you’re able to collect this evidence yourself where you need to
• You're outcomes focused – you have a bias for action to ensure we test and learn as we go, consistently progressing towards the end goal. There’s no time for perfection
• You have experience working in a cross-functional team. When you think about who your “team-mates” are, your 'go-to' will be engineers and designers

#LI-HS1

Flexible working? Yes please!

At Zopa we value flexible ways of working. We understand the benefits of face-to-face collaboration and the importance of a good work life balance. Our teams work in a hybrid manner from our open-plan, riverside London Bridge office and the comfort of their own homes at a frequency that suits the team and the work they do.

Not only that – you'll also have the option of working from abroad for up to 120 days a year!* But no matter where you are, we’ll make sure you’ve got everything you need to thrive, both in your work and home life, from day one. 
• Subject to having the right to work in the country of choice

Diversity Statement

Zopa is proud to offer a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and backgrounds leads to better products for our customers and a unique company culture for our people. We are made up of nearly 50 nationalities, have a DE&I forum made up of Zopians wanting to make a difference and we are proud of our culture where everyone can bring their full self to work. Our approach to DE&I is reflected in our hiring process so please let us know if you require any reasonable adjustments

title: Product Manager
description:
Requirements
• Experience as a Product Manager for products destined for use by Software Engineers, System Architects, Data Professionals or ML Engineers,
• In lieu of official experience in product management, we would also consider relevant experience in product design or tech leadership, with relevant cross-skilling in product management (such as online courses, certifications),
• Fluency with user experience design concepts,
• In-depth knowledge of Agile methodologies and a proven track record of managing all aspects of a successful product throughout its lifecycle,
• Understanding and/or hands-on experience in software development and web app technologies,
• Skilled at working effectively with cross functional teams in a remote-first organization,
• Strong problem solving skills,
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with customers and colleagues alike,
• You’re passionate and you care a lot – you have a genuine passion for the data privacy & governance domain, and... towards building trusting relationships with your colleagues and customers,
• You collaborate with and influence others – you’re a team player, who values collaboration and achieving things together,
• You’ve got excellent interpersonal skills – you have strong written and oral communication skills to effectively share knowledge and ideas and bring people along on the journey with you,
• You’re organised – you have strong attention to detail and time management skills, and ensure you meet release deadlines,
• You want to grow and you want your team to grow – you have a positive attitude towards change and uncertainty, and have a desire to continuously grow and learn,
• You embrace coaching – whether it is mentoring team members, or your own coachability,
• You’re endlessly curious – you actively seek to understand more through networking, questioning and research, and you persist while preserving relationships,
• You think strategically and make decisions – you have keen business acumen and approach problems from different angles. You use the available information to make effective decisions and recommendations,
• You walk it like you talk it - you keep your commitments and communicate if deadlines need to change

What the job involves
• You'll be helping to protect the data rights of millions of our clients' customers as the newest member of our talented team,
• Your expertise will be key in collaborating with engineers to break features down into prioritised backlogs, taking ownership of defining, prioritising, and accepting the work delivered by the pods,
• Ohalo team is growing, and we’re now looking for a sharp and mission-driven Product Manager to join our Product & Engineering team,
• You will work hand in hand with the Product Director and Engineering Teams to help us make things happen,
• There will be some asynchronous work, but you should anticipate a certain amount of Synchronous work given the nature of the Product Manager role - hence, the need for a minimum 5 hour overlap with 0900-1700 CET,
• Report Line: Product Director,
• Key Stakeholders: Product Director, CTO, Engineering Managers, Engineering Team Members,
• Create product plans and roadmaps for a product development pod (4-7 team members),
• Collect and analyze feedback from customers, stakeholders and other teams to shape requirements, features and end products,
• Develop and implement product strategies consistent with company vision,
• Communicate and build awareness for new and upcoming features both internally and externally through product marketing announcements, webinars and demos,
• Translate product strategy into detailed requirements and prototypes,
• Produce feature specifications and review product requirements documents (PRD),
• Review and provide edits for product documentation and release notes,
• Work closely with engineering teams to deliver with quick time-to-market and optimal resources,
• Ensure products and releases are launched correctly and on schedule,
• Suggest ways to track product use and impact on end users,
• Make creative recommendations to expand product base and vision,
• Co-develop product pricing and positioning strategies,
• The Team - who you'll be working with:,
• Product Director,
• Alistair Jones - CTO,
• A pod of 4-7 other engineers

title: Lead Product Manager, Martech
description:
Company Description

Depop is the community-powered fashion marketplace to buy and sell circular fashion, with over 30 million registered users in more than 150 countries. Depop is a place for anyone to discover and celebrate their style on their own terms, and to feel good about their fashion choices by extending the lives of millions of garments.

The company was founded in 2011 and is headquartered in London with offices in Manchester and New York. Depop has approximately 400 employees dedicated to its mission of building the world’s most diverse progressive home of fashion, that’s kinder on the planet and kinder to people. In 2021, Depop became a wholly-owned subsidiary of Etsy - the global marketplace for unique and creative goods - and continues to operate as a standalone company.

Depop is an equal opportunity employer. Our mission is to build the world’s most diverse progressive home of fashion. To do this, we encourage people from underrepresented communities to apply. We... celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We’re continuing to build recruitment processes that are fair and welcome requests for reasonable adjustments required throughout your interview experience with us. Depop supports visa sponsorship, sponsorship opportunities may be limited to certain roles and skillsets.

Job Description

At Depop, we work in multidisciplinary teams (Product, Engineering, Data Science, Analytics) that focus on a given internal or external customer problem space. We are collaborative in our approach and you will drive the product vision, prioritise roadmaps based on business objectives, work well with marketeers, analysts and engineers, gather data to drive decision making across multiple production teams, and ensure alignment and buy-in from a variety of business stakeholders. This role will report to the Director of Product & Technology Operations and depending on your experience and interest, could line manage the Martech Product team who are embedded in the AdTech & CommsTech squads.

As a Lead Product Manager for Marketing Technology, you will play a pivotal role at depop, leading our Martech teams to expand the capabilities of our marketing teams. You will be responsible for identifying, evolving and optimising the capabilities, tools and systems that we need to surface engaging and relevant marketing content that drive our users to perform valuable (and attributable) actions. Your work will directly enable revenue generation and return on investment for our Paid marketeers.

Responsibilities:
• Work with stakeholders and the Martech team to build a feasible roadmap that enables us to achieve our marketing goals.
• Define and monitor MarTech KPIs in collaboration with Paid Marketing, Product, Engineering & other key stakeholders.
• Be a key driver of defining, evolving and executing on our Adtech strategy, which aligns with the company's broader goals and vision and flexes according to the changing privacy and tooling landscape.
• Work closely with the Martech engineering and product leads, rolling your sleeves up and troubleshooting any technical challenges, making trade-offs, recognising and resolving, or escalating any obstacles before they impact delivery.
• Ensure that all Martech products and practices comply with relevant current and upcoming regulations.
• Keep return on investment at the forefront of your mind, work with the engineering and marketing teams to evaluate build vs buy options in the Adtech space.
• Make informed, pragmatic decisions, effectively communicate your rationale and learnings to technical and non-technical peers and stakeholders, foster the sharing of knowledge and understanding between the team and their internal customers.
• Keep abreast of and share industry trends, privacy changes, competitor offerings, and emerging technologies to maintain Depop's competitive edge.
• Identify and leverage the expertise of key functional stakeholders (e.g. Engineering, Data Science, Analytics, Legal, Marketing, Product) and other squads to help align, evolve and execute on the strategy for your area.

Qualifications

Must-haves:
• Expert adtech domain knowledge. You have a deep and applied understanding of the advertising ecosystem, including product catalogues, ad conversion data, targeting and measurement, as well as the changing privacy and compliance scape
• Well versed in the Martech technical stack. You’re a hands-on, pragmatic problem solver who collaborates closely with engineering to deliver value to users early and often. You have a proven ability to roll out marketing technology solutions in mobile apps.
• Entrepreneurial and analytical. You think constantly about driving results, have a strong bias to action and experience with end to end data reconciliation and validation, from the client to business reports.
• Experienced Product Manager. You have considerable experience as a Product Manager/Owner in an agile, fast-moving environment, with a focus on AdTech or digital advertising products (feeds, offsite ads, attribution etc).
• Excellent communication and leadership skills. You are adaptable, articulate, and can effectively influence and collaborate with all levels of stakeholders (up to exec).

Nice to Have:
• Experience and interest in people management of at least 1-2 direct reports
• Experience working in a marketplace or ecommerce platform business.
• Applied knowledge of other aspects of Martech/marketing experience, for example CRM and customer engagement tooling
• An engineering background
• Experience with customer data platforms like Segment and building reverse ETL systems, tag management tools such as Google Tag Manager, and Marketing Analytics software such as Branch and GA4.
• A love of fashion and sustainability, especially if you’re already part of the Depop community.

Additional Information

UK Benefits

Health + Mental Wellbeing
• PMI and cash plan healthcare access with Bupa
• Subsidised counselling and coaching - we partner with Self Space to provide you with the opportunity for a good conversation with a qualified person
• Cycle to Work scheme - choose between Evans or the Green Commute Initiative to help access a bike for your commute
• Employee Assistance Programme (EAP) - have access to a confidential support network of expert advice 24/7
• Mental Health First Aiders - we have trained individuals across the business to offer support and signposting

Work/Life Balance
• 25 days annual leave with the option to carry over up to 5 days
• 1 company-wide day off per quarter, for you to take some time for yourself and decompress
• Impact hours: At Depop, we offer all full-time employees up to the equivalent of 2 days additional paid leave per year to volunteer. We allocate this time in hours to help you engage with your community with ease and flexibility.

Flexible Working

MyMode is our hybrid-working model, designed to empower our employees to choose a working mode that works for them. MyMode is composed of 3 working modes: Flex, Office Based and Remote.
• Flex: we'd love you to head to your nearest Depop office once a week, but feel free to work from home the rest of the week.
• Office: Want to head into the office more? No problem, you can opt to be "Office-Based", with your very own desk.
• Remote: depending on your role you can request to be a remote worker, and only head into the office 4 times per year.

All of our offices are also dog-friendly! Do your best work with your best friend.

You can also apply to work abroad for 4 weeks of the year (in UK tax treaty countries).

Family Life

Our parental leave policies aim to support and enable parents to play equal roles in nurturing their families, in a way that is flexible and truly gender-neutral. Our full-time regular employees are eligible for 18 weeks of paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of their child. We also offer IVF leave, shared parental leave and paid emergency parent/carer leave.

Learn and Grow
• We offer budgets for conferences, learning subscriptions and more. We also sponsor and run a myriad of programmes, conferences and meet-ups to upskill our employees and enhance their journey with us.

Your Future
• Life Insurance (financial compensation of 3x your salary)
• Pension (Depop will match your contribution up to 6% of your qualifying earnings)

And finally, as a valued Depop employee we waive all of our employees’ fees when they sell on Depop so you can ship your sold items anywhere in the UK for free

title: Director, Product Management (Remote)
description:
Who We Are (Mode Mobile)

Mode Mobile is the creator of EarnOS, a transformational software that turns ordinary smartphones into "EarnPhones". This innovation empowers users globally to monetize everyday mobile activities such as streaming, gaming, shopping, etc. We enable users to profit from their data and attention, rather than letting only tech giants benefit. What sets us apart is our inclusive approach - converting users into earners, facilitating over $150M in earnings and savings, while going a step further and turning earners into owners by awarding stock ownership in Mobile Mobile based on their usage. We have attracted over 40 million users across 170 countries.

​​Mode Mobile is proud to stand as the #1 Fastest Growing North American Software Company recognized in Deloitte's 2023 Technology Fast 500, and ranked #2 across all sectors (Deloitte Fast 500 Winners)

For additional insights check out the information about our reward-based super app, Mode Earn App, that also... powers the reward engine behind our proprietary smartphone, Mode Earn Phone.

Our Team and Culture Drive Our Success

Our team is the heart of our culture. We value innovation, collaboration, and curiosity, with a passion for getting things done. We strive to hire and cultivate the best team member and foster a culture of open communication and transparency. We are driven and hard-working but also committed to having fun along the way. We allow OKRs to guide us, assume positive intent, sometimes agree to disagree and commit, honor our commitments, seek to accomplish more with less, and encourage everyone to speak up as our team owns our company’s success.

You can read more about our team and how we work here.

The Role

As the Director of Product Management, you will be critical in shaping our products' direction, development, and strategy. You will lead a global team of product managers and work closely with engineering and other cross-functional teams to deliver outstanding products that meet market needs and company goals. You'll own the product lifecycle with the Chief Information Officer, from crafting the vision and roadmap to guiding development, launching, and optimizing our app for maximum user engagement and growth.

Who You Are and What You’ll Do:

Vision & Strategic Leadership:
• Implement and maintain a product vision, strategy, and roadmap aligned with the company's business vision and strategy. Oversee the entire lifecycle from conception to launch across our various product lines.
• Conduct and maintain market research - competitive analysis, trends, and user research - to identify opportunities for differentiation and growth.
• Develop and maintain team objectives and key results (OKRs) aligned to key performance indicators (KPIs) and organizational goals.
• Accountable for managing the Product’s P&L growth.

Team Management, Communication, and Collaboration:
• Assist in hiring, onboarding, and training product managers.
• Lead, mentor, and grow a team of geographically diverse product managers, setting clear goals and expectations while fostering a culture of excellence, collaboration, and communication.
• Develop and maintain team-wide development and career growth plans, providing guidance and opportunities for professional growth.
• Build strong relationships with team members, fostering trust and transparency across the organization.
• Collaborate with customer success, finance, product marketing, and other departments to ensure a seamless user experience across all touchpoints.

Product Development, Execution, and Optimization:
• Communicate the product vision, strategy, objectives, and key results effectively to company stakeholders, including executives, investors, and partners.
• Work closely with engineering, design, and marketing teams to ensure product development aligns with objectives and key results.
• Collaborate with internal stakeholders and external partners to ensure alignment and support for product initiatives.
• Champion user-centricity throughout the organization, ensuring user needs and data insights drive all decisions.
• Manage the product development process across teams, ensuring timely delivery of high-quality features within budget and scope.
• Analyze financial performance, user data, and performance metrics to identify areas for improvement and optimize the app for engagement and retention.

What You Bring to the Team:
• Minimum of 7-10 years of experience in product management, with at least 2 years as a Director of Product Management.
• Proven track record of successfully launching and scaling mobile app products while successfully managing the Product’s profit and loss growth.
• Excellent leadership and team management skills with the ability to inspire and motivate cross-functional teams.
• Strong understanding of user-centered design principles and qualitative/quantitative research methodologies.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate data into actionable insights.
• Outstanding written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present complex information clearly and concisely.
• Experience working in a fast-paced startup environment with a willingness to adapt and embrace change.
• Experience managing and working with remote, geographically distributed teams.
• Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
• Alignment with our core values:
• Action-driven: Identify what is most important, agree on scope, execute in a timely manner, and drive the greatest impact. You take initiative, roll up your sleeves, and get things done.
• Caring: You genuinely care about yourself and others, our business and craft, our mission and vision, and are passionate in heart and mind. You understand the importance of our team and strive to create a positive, supportive work environment.
• Curious: You focus on the ‘why,’ learn and expand your knowledge, explore new ideas, and generally make things better. You're a lifelong learner with a thirst for knowledge and a constant desire to improve.
• Thorough: Your work is thoughtful, impactful, timely, accurate, and complete. You pay attention to detail, are meticulous, and ensure quality work and compliance.

We All Share The Same Core Values
• Action-Driven
• Curious
• Caring
• Thorough

We Believe In The Following Workplace Norms
• Allow OKRs to Guide Us
• Assume Positive Intent
• Agree to Disagree & Commit
• Set New Precedents
• Accomplish More with Less
• Hold Yourself & Others to High Standards
• Speak Up
• Be Resourceful
• Follow the 80/20 Rule

What We Are Offering
• We are a 100% remote-first, global company.
• A competitive compensation package.
• We offer generous perks & benefits to team members.
• Participation in the Company's equity and token plan (for full-time team members).
• We provide individual bonuses in accordance with our Company Bonus Program.
• Work with energetic, passionate, and results-driven people.
• Celebrate team members' personal and work milestones.
• Remote social activities, including virtual coffee buddies.
• Bonus.ly - We use Bonus.ly as a way to recognize and reward team members for their hard work and commitment.
• Weekly Wednesday Get Stuff Done Days (No Meetings).
• Open PTO, generous Company Holidays, and Wellness Days (for full-time team members).

If we just described you and your perfect role, we'd love to talk with you. We have a lot to accomplish this year and look forward to making headway and creating success together!

Mode Mobile does not accept/pay fees for unsolicited resumes from third-party agencies/vendors.

Our company is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer. We are committed to providing a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We celebrate diversity and strive to create an inclusive environment for all team members

title: Product Manager Transfer Agency
description:
Position Type :
Full time

Type Of Hire :
Experienced (relevant combo of work and education)

Education Desired :
Bachelor's Degree

Travel Percentage :
10 - 15%

We are FIS. Our technology powers the world’s economy and our teams bring innovation to life. We champion diversity to deliver the best products and solutions for our colleagues, clients and communities. If you’re ready to start learning, growing and making an impact with a career in fintech, we’d like to know: Are you FIS?

About the role:
The Transfer Agency Product manager is responsible for defining and providing strategic direction for FIS’s TA services. As part of the TA Product Solutions team, the TA Product manager provides consultative support to Clients, collaborates closely with technology product and development teams, liaises with internal service delivery teams (BPAS), and provides strategic and market insights for our TA services globally, with a local market focus. The TA Product Manager is responsible for... commercialization of TA services.

What you will be doing:
• Preparing and presenting product plans that identify risks and challenges, opportunities and growth strategies.
• Participating in budget planning process, providing content for product roadmaps and ensuring timely delivery.
• Monitoring each product’s profit and loss statement.
• Collaborating with senior management, completing business scope documents and managing key vendor relationships

What you will need:
• General business skills, industry knowledge, financial management and planning skills, long-term vision and executive presence.
• Knowledge of financial services industry and associated products, with relevant Transfer Agency experience.
• Ability to work independently and in collaborative global teams
• Strong verbal and written communication skills
• A bachelor's degree or multiple years direct Transfer Agency experience

What we offer you:
• A multifaceted job with a high degree of responsibility and a broad spectrum of opportunities
• A modern, international work environment and a dedicated and motivated team
• A variety of career development tools, resources and opportunities
• A competitive salary
• A fantastic range of benefits including private medical cover, dental cover and travel insurance

Privacy Statement

FIS is committed to protecting the privacy and security of all personal information that we process in order to provide services to our clients. For specific information on how FIS protects personal information online, please see the Online Privacy Notice.

Sourcing Model

Recruitment at FIS works primarily on a direct sourcing model; a relatively small portion of our hiring is through recruitment agencies. FIS does not accept resumes from recruitment agencies which are not on the preferred supplier list and is not responsible for any related fees for resumes submitted to job postings, our employees, or any other part of our company.

#pridepass

title: Product Manager - Hometrack
description:
Houseful is home to trusted brands Zoopla, Alto, Hometrack, Calcasa, Mojo and Prime location. Together we’re creating the connections that power better property decisions, by unlocking the combined strength of software, data and insight.

We make moves with head and heart to achieve our big ambitions, and to drive progress in the property market. There’s never been a better time to join us.

Hometrack is redefining the mortgage journey for lenders, brokers and consumers by delivering the market leading digital valuation and property risk decisioning and property data service to financial services, property and technology industries. Our key commercial and go to market segment is in financial services, primarily mortgage lenders including 9 of the top 10 mortgage providers.

The role

We are looking for an experienced Product Manager to join the Product team at Hometrack, part of Houseful. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in the business, being responsible for the... product development and delivery of features for our flagship property risk platform for lenders.

Property Risk Hub is our data, decisioning and analytics platform lenders can configure and integrate with for instant mortgage decisioning throughout the end-to-end mortgage journey. As a Product Manager you will partner with a Senior Product Manager to understand and align the development plan to property and climate risk and decision automation strategy and organise the backlog, prioritising and assessing items of work for an Agile engineering team, to roll out new products, propositions, enhancements, and functionalities.

Key responsibilities
• Collaborate with your team through discovery to test your hypothesis, using data and insight to drive your decision making and product development.
• Steer prioritisation at the product team level, within the constraints of the agreed objectives and outcomes as well as manage and communicate tradeoffs.
• Facilitate workshops with business and technical stakeholders for discovery and to gather business needs and input, resolving issues and clearing obstacles.
• Break business requirements down into features and user stories with clear acceptance criteria, working with the Software and Solution Architect to establish feasibility and approach.
• Work with the engineering team to refine stories and estimate subtasks, set sprint goals and plan and coordinate releases.
• Groom, sequence and prioritise the backlog in accordance with the product roadmap, technology strategy and resource availability.
• Support the cross team product operations to continuously refine and improve our agile methodology.
• Collaborate with commercial, sales and product marketing on the go to market strategy for new products or services including pricing, calculations of costs and ROI and CAC.
• Keep key stakeholders up to date, communicating short, medium and longer term roadmap as well as release planning, management and communications.
• Accountable for the tracking and performance of all KPIs for your product, implementing product analytics and ensuring a focus on performance is embedded within your team.

Essential skills
• Experience as a Product Manager in a data rich environment, preferably financial services, fintech or proptech or in another analytics focused product organisation.
• Experience building data products and data centric API’s you understand technical language and terms used for api-first services, automated processes and have database knowledge.
• Highly collaborative approach to product development with cross-functional delivery teams and stakeholders.
• Value-centric approach to work. You are driven by delivering measurable value to customers
• Agile software development and product discovery methodologies. You reflect the importance of continuous, iterative delivery of value, plus the tools and techniques to facilitate this. You define solutions based on a thorough, methodical and data-driven approach.
• Team spirit and highly effective written and verbal communication skills to lead and influence a range of technical and non-technical stakeholders.
• Obsession with learning. Whether it’s driving key product KPIs, learning new skills or the nuances of the market you are always reflecting on what can be improved and how to get there.

We want to make Houseful more welcoming, fair and representative every day. We’ll consider everyone who applies for this role in the same way, regardless of your ethnicity, colour, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, physical disability, neurodiversity status, family or parental status, or how long you’ve spent unemployed. We’re reimagining the property industry for everyone, so we want our team to represent people from all walks of life. We actively welcome your application if your demographics or background are underrepresented in the technology or property sector
• Everyday Flex - greater flexibility over where and when you work
• 25 days annual leave + extra days for years of service
• Day off for volunteering & Digital detox day
• Festive Closure - business closed for period between Christmas and New Year
• Cycle to work and electric car schemes
• Free Calm App membership
• Enhanced Parental leave
• Fertility Treatment Financial Support
• Group Income Protection and private medical insurance
• Gym on-site in London
• 7.5% pension contribution by the company
• Discretionary annual bonus up to 10% of base salary
• Talent referral bonus up to £5K

title: Product Relationship Manager, Showmax
description:
Company Description

NBCUniversal owns and operates over 20 different businesses across 30 countries including a valuable portfolio of news and entertainment television networks, a premier motion picture company, significant television production operations, a leading television stations group, world-renowned theme parks and a premium ad-supported streaming service.

Here you can be your authentic self. As a company uniquely positioned to educate, entertain and empower through our platforms, Comcast NBCUniversal stands for including everyone. We strive to foster a diverse and inclusive culture where our employees feel supported, embraced and heard. We believe that our workforce should represent the communities we live in, so that together, we can continue to create and deliver content that reflects the current and ever-changing face of the world. Click here to learn more about Comcast NBCUniversal’s commitment and how we are making an impact.

Job Description

Our Direct-to-Consumer... (DTC) portfolio is a powerhouse collection of consumer-first brands, supported by media industry leaders, Comcast, NBCUniversal and Sky. When you join our team, you'll work across our dynamic portfolio including Peacock, NOW, Fandango, SkyShowtime, Showmax, and TV Everywhere, powering streaming across more than 70 countries globally. And the evolution doesn't stop there. With unequalled scale, our teams make the most out of every opportunity to collaborate and learn from one another. We're always looking for ways to innovate faster, accelerate our growth and consistently offer the very best in consumer experience. But most of all, we're backed by a culture of respect. We embrace authenticity and inspire people to thrive.

Primary focus

Provide strategic product partnership and relationship management between Peacock Commerce Product and Showmax.

Key Responsibilities
• Serve as the primary point of contact and key liaison between Showmax business partners and the Peacock Commerce Product org
• Help inform Showmax business strategy from a Commerce product perspective
• Understand, influence and manage Showmax requests and expectations
• Partner with Commerce Product Managers to inform and align roadmap priorities and timelines
• Oversee the Showmax commerce feature intake and collaborate with stakeholders to provide RICE scoring inputs and business valuation
• Continuously engage with Showmax stakeholders, ensuring we are meeting strategic product and business objectives
• Maintain fluid communication and alignment between parties
• Build rapport and earn trust

Qualifications
• Excellent collaboration and facilitation skills with the ability to develop and maintain solid relationships
• Clear communication and comprehensive documentation skills
• Ability to navigate ambiguity and remain flexible
• Ability to work cross-functionally with both internal and external stakeholders
• Ability to prioritize multiple business requests
• Self-motivated, resourceful, detail-oriented and well-organized
• Ability to problem-solve and think orthogonally

Essential Knowledge and Experience:
• Minimum 3 - 5 years relevant experience in account or partner management within an agency, consultancy or client-side organization

Desirable Knowledge and Experience:
• Experience with OTT streaming or other digital subscription products a plus
• Background in global product expansion and multi-region/multi-language products a plus
• Previous experience with African-based business partners/clients a plus

This position is eligible for company sponsored benefits, including medical, dental and vision insurance, 401(k), paid leave, tuition reimbursement, and a variety of other discounts and perks. title: Associate Director Product Management (Financial Services)
description:
As an Associate Director Product Management (Financial Services) at Publicis Sapient, you will act as your clients’ trusted advisor in leading the overall business solution, vision, strategy, roadmap, and prioritisation for a specific digital product, or products, within an engagement. You will collaborate with our clients in the Financial Services industry undertaking major Digital Business Transformation (DBT) engagements to understand their business, end-customer needs, and then constantly deliver value with fast increment cycles.

Your Impact:

Partner with client(s), strategists, experience leads, and enterprise architects, to frame business goals and value streams from which we can shape solution propositions that provide transformative business outcomes and customer experience
Develop large solution vision that aligns with the product vision, strategy, and industry compliance, by keeping customer at the center of everything we do while using design thinking tools
• Represent... client while facilitating solution workshops with cross functional leaders where you identify new solution, organisation business needs, and solution options
• Develop solution hypotheses iteratively based on user research, and industry and market trend analysis
• Translate solution vision into a product vision/roadmap containing well-defined, prioritised features that will realise the solution and value
• Validate and present the business case to C–level executives and lead business reviews to ensure the team prioritises the right features
• Serve as a voice of the customer among the cross-functional team, always understanding and representing the customer needs
• Establish objective goals for the product with success and acceptance criteria using meaningful metrics, KPIs, and quantifiable business outcomes
• Masterfully apply Lean Agile practices and frameworks
• Collaborate with product managers, other solution managers, and cross-functional capability managers to ensure all product teams, to ensure alignment towards the same programme increment (PI) objectives
• Collaborate with enterprise architects to envision and prioritise capability enablers
• Represent industry best practice and market trends to assist the client in maintaining competitive advantage
• Build and maintain a trusting relationship with the client, teams, and vendors; develop influence without authority
• Inspire, lead, and mentor, a high-performing team of Product Analysts to continually facilitate improvements in developing and enhancing best-in-class digital products and services

title: Senior Product Manager - Consumer
description:
Zapp aims to revolutionise the stagnant convenience retail industry by providing a luxury customer-centric e-commerce platform.

Our vision is to disrupt the multi-trillion dollar convenience retail market, currently dominated by major players, by offering a diverse range of products, fair pricing, and efficient stock management. As we grow, we'll naturally diversify, always aligning with the market and our customers' needs.

We are powered by a highly experienced, driven and passionate team with backgrounds from renowned companies like Amazon and Tesco.

We are seeking a Senior Product Manager to join our team and work across our consumer products (Mobile & Web). In this role, you will be responsible for owning the end-to-end product experience for our customers. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including Engineering, Design, Marketing, Merchandising and Commercial to build and launch innovative products that drive the customer experience.

Here’s what you’d be... doing:

1. Define and own the product roadmap for our Consumer products (Mobile & Web)
2. Work closely with cross functional teams to ensure timely and
accurate delivery of products and features
3. Analyse customer and operations feedback to identify areas for improvement
and new product opportunities
4. Define and monitor key performance metrics to measure product success
5. Collaborate with Store Leadership, Design and UX teams to create an
intuitive and delightful delivery experience
6. Work with external partners and vendors to optimise delivery capabilities
and expand our network

The ideal candidate will have the following:

1. 5+ years of experience in Product Management on operations and
customer-facing applications
2. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a track record of using data
to drive product decisions
3. Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work
effectively with cross-functional teams
4. Experience building and launching successful products in a fast-paced, agile
environment
5. Familiarity with last-mile delivery technologies and e-commerce /
q-commerce industry trends

Benefits
• Competitive salary & equity package
• Enjoy 25 days holiday per year (plus all bank holidays)
• Private Health Insurance
• Extended sick pay and maternity / paternity leave pay
• We will contribute 3% to your pension
• Monthly Zapp Credit
• Be part of a dynamic company and a super motivated team

At Zapp we embrace diversity. We are committed to creating an inclusive and supportive work environment. We firmly believe that a variety of backgrounds & perspectives make our team stronger and bring our product closer to the customer.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we make all employment decisions without regard to age, national origin, race, ethnicity, religion, creed, gender, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law

title: Product Manager, eCommerce
description:
MOO set out to shake up the world of print back in 2006. And we’ve come a long way since. Today we’re a 400 + strong team (we’re thinking of getting matching jackets) who create print and digital products for companies of all sizes – from Google and AirBnB to the guy who makes those amazing prints you found at a craft fair.

Our global HQ is in London, UK, while we also have premises in Dagenham. In the US, you’ll find us in Boston, MA, as well as East Providence, RI and Denver, CO.

We’re making new and exciting things – and we could really do with your help.

Our 2025 strategy means delighting customers, new and old, with remarkable products and premium experiences. We are excited about this future and want to see at least part of this vision realised in 2022

A new team was set up because we identified a new customer segment with their own unique needs and we have had a new technology, customer and manufacturing strategy. This team is building a new platform and experience both for... our internal and external customers. This new platform is the future of MOO. We aim to offer this new solution to customers in a way that drives towards our longer term plans while adding value and data lead insight from the start.

The team are mostly based in the UK together and it is fully cross functional. This will be a hybrid role and we will expect you to attend our London office to collaborate with team mates and stakeholders at least once or twice per week.

The Role

Our Product team is growing and this role will be accountable for working with the cross functional team on defining Product outcomes, driving strategic prioritisation, testing and building the new platform based on our strategy. You will work closely with the Head of Product on the future direction of the platform - and ultimately of MOO.

There is a real mix of greenfield technology, continuous delivery, and customer facing discovery work to drive. But most importantly, it is about our fabulous internal and external customers.

The person we want
• B2B & B2C experience and an understanding of the unique needs of businesses over consumers
• Experience in eCommerce, Product Management, Order Management, Site Merchandising, Analytics, Customer Research
• Proficiency in user experience and design principles
• Familiarity with merchants’ technology stacks - ecommerce platforms, payment gateways or order management systems
• Highly motivated self-starter able to work with minimal supervision and direction
• Ability to context switch easily from technology, operations, research techniques, design best practices, short term team focuses, longer team opportunities etc
• Strong data skills across qualitative and quantitative data. Test, measure and learn approach to Product development
• Great storyteller who can bring people on the journey and inspire them
• Strong stakeholder management skills and experience
• Experience in working in an agile, cross functional development team, remote or distributed
• Lives and breathes the MOO values bringing enthusiasm and positivity to every problem

Responsibilities
• Shaping, building and maintaining the product roadmap. paying particular attention to the needs of our different customers (internal and external) and using real data (both qualitative and quantitative) to guide the prioritisation and solutions.
• Driving the process to scope detailed product requirements and prioritise key platform capabilities and features successfully
• Working alongside Engineering, Research, Design and Analytics to break the roadmap into outcomes and deliver using an iterative test & learn approach.
• Knowing your customers and their problems. Truly understand our user segments and their wants, needs and pain points by partnering with our in-house user research, design and customer service partners to lead an outcome-driven approach to product development.
• Defining and monitoring KPIs and proving incremental value of work delivered by the team and drive decision making.
• Leading and inspiring a cross functional development team to deliver great work with a mission and vision that everyone buys into.

About you
• You LOVE product. You love taking things apart, putting them back together, discovering problems and debating features. You are intrigued by juicy product problems in search of elegant, simple solutions. You have an agile mindset and love to learn. You are quick to recognise failures and pivot the product based on learnings. You have excellent attention to detail, both written and numerical and have a commitment to quality.
• You’re technically strong. You have a track record of successful delivery in a technical role. You’re able to discuss and translate complex technical capabilities and constraints and turn them into plain English and you can own and guide the improvement of technical capabilities. You can understand both customer needs and the technical architecture of the platforms and you’re able to identify and track key metrics to ensure that your products meet critical service levels.
• You’re customer-centric. Real, actionable customer insights rock your world. You value user research and actively seek out opportunities to understand your users better, identifying customer needs and solving real problems. You are positive, empathetic and persistently patient.
• You love building and strategizing. Your perfect week might include a user story mapping session; deep diving for insights in your data; discussing with stakeholders the perfect balance of optimisation and innovation; reviewing and signing off stories and celebrating wins with cake!
• You can joust with the best of them. You understand data flows, can converse with architects and engineers on the limitations of approaches, talk ‘discovery’ with our Designers and Researchers and can spot a bad smell from a mile away.
• You are highly self motivated. You have a real hunger to deliver customer excellence and ‘imagine it better’ for the customer internally and externally. You are able to work with minimal supervision and direction

Nice to haves
• Working with strategic 3rd party partners, suppliers and SaaS solutions.
• Familiarity with merchants’ technology stacks - ecommerce platforms, payment gateways or order management systems
• Experience of contract negotiation and vendor selection

What’s it like to work at MOO?

MOO’s the kind of workplace where you can really be yourself. Dye your hair purple. Hit the sofa with your laptop. Whatever helps you feel comfortable and happy at work. We want to help you grow in your career and set you up for success – while also recognising the importance of a healthy work/life balance.

That’s why we offer 25 days holiday rising by one day for each year here (for 5 years), a matched pension scheme, MOO’s share option scheme, and paid parental leave. We’ll offer you private healthcare, life insurance, a season ticket loan, and a cycle to work scheme. We also offer flexible work schedules with hybrid and remote working for certain roles as well as a Work From Anywhere program.

Diversity Statement

We are working hard to create a representative, inclusive and super-friendly team, because we know that different experiences, perspectives and backgrounds make for a better workplace. And that creates a better experience for our customers. MOO doesn’t discriminate on the basis of race, colour, religion or belief, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital status, disability or any other protected class.

As a design and technology company we have a desire and a responsibility to build a business that represents the world around us. So we strive to create a values-driven, purposeful and highly empowered organisation that we are all proud to work for. And we are committed to continuous investment in building an open and inclusive environment, welcoming a diverse audience of candidates who see themselves working and thriving at MOO. Therefore, we’d like to invite you to complete this optional survey to help us evaluate our inclusion and diversity efforts. Completing this form is entirely voluntary and if you decide not to it won’t in any way affect your job application. We keep the information separate from your application and it is kept secure and confidential, it is only used to better our inclusion and diversity efforts. By submitting this information, you consent to MOO's processing of it for these purposes

title: Product Manager, Mobile Security, Vice President
description:
Out of the successful launch of Chase in 2021, we’re a new team, with a new mission. We’re creating products that solve real world problems and put customers at the centre - all in an environment that nurtures skills and helps you realize your potential. Our team is key to our success. We’re people-first. We value collaboration, curiosity and commitment.

As a VP, Product Manager at JPMorgan Chase within the Customer and Identity tribe, you are the heart of this venture, focused on getting smart ideas into the hands of our customers. You have a curious mindset, thrive in collaborative squads, and are passionate about new technology. By your nature, you are also solution-oriented, commercially savvy and have a head for fintech. You thrive in working in tribes and squads that focus on specific products and projects – and depending on your strengths and interests, you'll have the opportunity to move between them.

While we’re looking for professional skills, culture is just as important... to us. We understand that everyone's unique – and that diversity of thought, experience and background is what makes a good team, great. By bringing people with different points of view together, we can represent everyone and truly reflect the communities we serve. This way, there's scope for you to make a huge difference – on us as a company, and on our clients and business partners around the world.

Job responsibilities:
• Own the mobile app security technology stack (examples cryptographic key management, secure authentication, digital signature and mobile threat defense) for all customer groups and propositions.
• Identify future risks that are driven by product or channel development and mitigation of these risks through appropriate strategies.
• Working across a wide group of teams (product teams, payments, engineering, technology, risk) to ensure that key partners are aware of all of the importance of the product.
• Communicate effectively across teams and gain credibility by understanding end to end impacts of the authentication strategies that are implemented.
• Collaborate effectively with colleagues across the firm including business, technology, product management, operations management, legal, compliance, risk, audit, and technology control functions to drive engagement with the program of work.
• Key understanding of innovation and operational impacts of managing mobile app security strategy from a wide range of vendor systems
• Act as a subject matter expert and share best practice across the firm.

Required qualifications, capabilities and skills:
• Formal training or certification in a science, computing, engineering or mathematics based subject, or relevant applied experience in Product Management
• Knowledge of encryption algorithms e.g. AES, RSA, ECC to secure data at rest and in transit
• Knowledge of cryptographic protocols like SSL / TLS, SSH and IPsec for securing communications between devices and applications
• Familiarity with authentication mechanisms e.g. Multi factor authentication, OAuth
• Familiarity with techniques for Device binding, App Hardening, Secure Key Management etc.
• Experience of delivering in an agile environment.
• Exceptional problem solving and analytical skills. Solid critical thinking and analysis in technical scenarios, attention to detail and able to synthesize large amounts of data and formulate creative and innovative solutions to complex problems.
• Communication/presentation - excellent written and verbal communication skills with an ability to influence business leaders in a meaningful and actionable manner.
• Networking –interpersonal skills; collaboration, openness and relationship building skills
• Able to work autonomously to affect change - flexible, adaptable to shifting priorities; manages competing priorities to achieve the most effective result and able to work in a fast-paced, results driven environment.
• Vendor management – ability to understand a vendor product offering and ability to integrate into current technology stack

Preferred qualifications, capabilities and skills:
• Experience in tools like Cryptomathic, Zimperium etc.
• Ideally will have a background in banking Apps and websites

title: Technical Product Manager | Core Translation Backend
description:
DeepL, Europe's leading AI company since 2017, is dedicated to breaking down language barriers and bringing cultures closer together. Our expertise in AI and neural networks has enabled us to create cutting-edge communication technologies for businesses, including the acclaimed DeepL Translator which offers 30+ languages, and DeepL Write, our AI writing companion. Our core offering includes a suite of products and tools made for businesses to communicate more effectively, both internally and with their customers around the globe.

Our goal is to become the global leader in Language AI and build products that help drive better communication, drive connection, and make real-life impact. To do that, we need talented people, like you, who want to be a part of this exciting journey. If you're ready to work with a dynamic team and build your career in the fast-moving AI space, DeepL is your destination.

What sets us apart

Our goal is to become the global leader in Language AI and build... products that help drive better communication, drive connection, and make real-life impact. To do that, we need talented people, like you, who want to be a part of this exciting journey. If you're ready to work with a dynamic team and build your career in the fast-moving AI space, DeepL is your destination.

Meet the team behind this journey

Core Translation Backend is a platform team that provides high quality APIs for most of DeepL’s core services. We build these APIs by integrating advanced neural networks from our research department. We work closely with the research department to provide state-of-the-art AI technologies to other teams inside the company and to our end users. To distribute the inference work, we dynamically optimize latency and throughput using a custom load balancer. The team is made of two sub-teams: one focuses on the APIs, the other on job orchestration.

Technical Product Managers at DeepL are regular members of the Product team, but with an additional level of software development expertise that makes it easier to excel while working with platform teams.

Your responsibilities
• Define the mission, strategy and roadmap for the platform team, incorporating data, in accordance with the wider DeepL strategy
• Lead a collaborative team process to translate user and business needs into development requirements which drive impact
• Define metrics and KPIs to measure and report progress
• Ensure the maximum Return on Investment for all of your team’s efforts
• Communicate strategy, ideas and concepts clearly, aimed at the right audience, supported by data insights
• Identify opportunities for new features and products that leverage the global scale of our user base and data
• Cooperate with the team of engineers and the Engineering Manager to foster a culture of trust and maintain a healthy team with predictable delivery performance

Qualities we look for
• 3+ years of experience as a Product Manager on a technology product
• Degree in computer science or a related field
• Past experience in software development - we are looking for Product Managers with a strong technical background
• Experienced in driving the whole product lifecycle – research, prototyping, iterative development and testing, launch, and continuous improvement
• Consistent in using qualitative and quantitative insights to define strategy, goals and roadmap
• Analytical and focused on solving problems elegantly but simply. You are able to analyze and break down large problems to a structured approach, with small measurable steps to achieve your goals
• Data driven. You base your decisions on facts, not opinion, and always seek to validate any hypothesis both before and after implementation
• Experienced working on a product at scale, with an international footprint
• Strong communication and presentation skills with the help of insight and data
• Great command of the English language. Other languages would be an advantage.

What we offer
• Diverse and internationally distributed team: joining our team means becoming part of a large, global community with people of more than 90 nationalities. We're more than just colleagues; we're a group of professionals with a shared mission to connect diverse cultures. Our global presence is growing–we've doubled in size nearly every year, with our employees based in the UK, Germany, the Netherlands, Poland, the US, and Japan, and we continue to expand our network.
• Open communication, regular feedback: as a language-focused company, we value the importance of clear, honest communication. We value smooth collaboration, direct and actionable feedback, and believe that leading with empathy makes us better together.
• Remote work, flexible hours: whether you're near or in our hubs in cities like Cologne, Berlin, Amsterdam, London, or prefer the comfort of your own home, you decide where your office is. We offer remote opportunities, flexible working hours and trust in your productivity, all in sync with your team's general locations and time zones to foster effective and seamless collaboration. Our aim is to integrate your work with your lifestyle, ensuring a balance that respects both your needs and our operational requirements.
• Regular in-person team events: we bond over vibrant events that are as unique as our team, from local team and business unit gatherings, to new-joiner onboardings, to company-wide events that bring us all together–literally.
• Monthly full-day hacking sessions: every month, we have Hack Fridays, where you can spend your time diving into a project you're passionate about and get the opportunity to work with other teams–we value your initiatives, impact, and creativity.
• Comprehensive health insurance: your health comes first. With our comprehensive insurance, we'll make sure you're covered from head to toe.
• 30 days of annual leave: we value your peace of mind. With 30 days off (excluding public holidays) and access to mental health resources, we make sure you're as strong mentally as you are professionally.
• Annual learning budget: because we never stop learning, we’ve set up an annual budget for your professional development—pick a learning path which contributes to your career development and we'll back you up.

If this role and our mission resonate with you, but you're hesitant because you don't check all the boxes, don't let that hold you back. At DeepL, it's all about the value you bring and the growth we can foster together. Go ahead, apply—let's discover your potential together. We can't wait to meet you!

Please make sure to send your application in English

title: Product Manager (Pharmaceuticals)
description:
Sanofi is looking for an experienced and passionate Product Manager (Pharmaceuticals) to join our team. The ideal candidate will be a strategic and creative thinker who is able to effectively drive product launches, campaigns, and strategies. This position requires an individual who is results-oriented, organized, and can work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment. Responsibilities:

title: Product Manager
description:
Client Overview:

Join an esteemed organization committed to revolutionizing the financial services industry through innovative technology solutions. Our client, a leading player in the sector, is seeking a dynamic Product Manager to drive and manage technology-enabled transformational change, discovery, and innovation for their Advice products. This role will play a pivotal part in optimizing user experiences and data processes to support the client's strategic objectives. Starting ASAP, paying up to 75,000 per annum.

Position Overview:

The Product Manager will be a highly motivated individual obsessed with managing and optimizing great user experiences and data processes to support the client's strategy. This hybrid role combines aspects of Product Owner and Product Management functions, offering an exciting opportunity to lead transformative initiatives within the organization.

Responsibilities:

title: Senior Product Manager, Home & Broadband
description:
This a Full Remote job, the offer is available from: United Kingdom

Who We Are

The name ThousandEyes was born from two big ideas: the power to see things not ordinarily possible and the ability to collect insights from a multitude of vantage points. As organizations rely more on cloud services and the Internet, the network has become a “black box” outside of their control. ThousandEyes gives organizations visibility and insight into the now borderless network. It arms them with an accurate understanding of how the network impacts their applications, users and customers. ThousandEyes is used by some of the world’s largest and fastest growing brands, including all of the top 5 global software companies, 5 of the top 6 US banks, and 45 of the Fortune 500.

ThousandEyes’ pioneered Cloud and Internet Intelligence and is widely known as the ‘Google Maps of the Internet.’ Today, ThousandEyes is central to the global operations of the world’s largest and fastest-growing brands. The company... was acquired by Cisco in August 2020, chartered with continuing to drive leadership in empowering organizations to see, understand, and improve digital experiences everywhere.

About The Team

The rise of as-a-service models has given birth to unknown dependencies that create blind spots for enterprise teams. Our product management team focuses on ingesting, visualizing, and correlating network flow traffic with our existing market-leading synthetics dataset. Our team helps customers solve problems that originate within the network infrastructure they own.

About The Role

Last year, ThousandEyes acquired SamKnows, and, in an era where connectivity is paramount, the acquisition of SamKnows marks a significant step forward in our mission to enhance network visibility and performance, particularly in the critical last-mile segment and within consumer homes. This integration empowers Internet Service Providers (ISPs) and consumers with insightful data to identify connectivity and application issues, whether they originate in the home or beyond.

We are looking for a visionary Senior Product Manager to spearhead this transformative integration. Your role will be pivotal in developing innovative solutions that provide real-time insights into network performance in the last mile and consumer environments. This position demands a blend of business acumen, technical expertise in network software, a deep understanding of ISP infrastructure, and a consumer-centric approach to problem-solving.

What You Will Do
• Lead the development and launch of cutting-edge solutions that enhance network visibility in the last mile and within the home.
• Collaborate closely with technical teams from both SamKnows and ThousandEyes to ensure seamless integration of technologies and expertise.
• Engage directly with ISPs and consumers to thoroughly understand their connectivity challenges and tailor solutions to address these issues effectively.
• Conduct in-depth market research and competitive analysis to stay ahead of industry trends and position our products strategically.
• Define a clear and ambitious product vision and roadmap, focusing on innovation, usability, and impact in network performance monitoring.
• Facilitate cross-functional team collaboration, ensuring alignment with the product goals and adherence to development timelines.
• Partner with Marketing, Sales, and Customer Success teams to craft compelling narratives and tools that resonate with our target audiences, driving successful product adoption and market penetration.

Required Skills
• A minimum of 6 years of experience in product management, with a significant focus on network performance software and ISP services.
• Experience in enterprise/SaaS software products
• Prior experience in a startup or dynamic technology environment, particularly involving network monitoring or management software solutions.
• Deep knowledge of network performance metrics, diagnostic tools, and software applications relevant to ISP infrastructure and home networking.
• Strong analytical skills, with the ability to translate complex technical concepts into consumer-friendly solutions.
• Excellent communication and collaboration abilities, capable of leading diverse teams and engaging effectively with various stakeholders.
• A self-starter attitude fueled by passion and energy, with the capability to drive innovation and lead change in a fast-paced industry.

Cisco values the perspectives and skills that emerge from employees with diverse backgrounds. That's why Cisco is expanding the boundaries of discovering top talent by not only focusing on candidates with educational degrees and experience but also placing more emphasis on unlocking potential. Cisco is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis. title: Product Manager (Analytics & Reporting) - B2B SaaS Fintech
description:
Landytech is on a mission to revolutionize how investment managers, asset owners and their advisors access their information. Powered by Sesame, an industry-leading investment reporting platform, we are helping clients in over 15 countries make informed investment decisions and deliver insights faster.

The company is growing rapidly, having secured $12M in Series B funding in January 2023. In just four years, it has gone from two co-founders to a diverse team of almost 100 staff from over 15 countries, with offices in London and Paris.

Team & Role

We are looking to hire a Product Manager to join the Product Team and help drive our Analytics and Reporting pillar. The role will report to our VP Product and will be central to the enhancement of our Sesame product roadmap.

title: Product Manager
description:
Product Manager

Department: Retail Management

Employment Type: Permanent - Full Time

Location: Manchester Trafford Park
Description
We’re a much-loved brand with an exciting future. Our Islanders are a diverse bunch of bright, talented people who love working together – and are proud of the work they do. Progression here can take you in all kinds of directions.

This is what a career at River Island is like. And this is where yours starts.

What We Are Looking For...
Focus
• Drive omni- channel sales and data capture through delivering the best service on the high street
• Increase conversion through customer engagement and spreading the joy of fashion
• Inspire customers using both verbal and visual engagement with the product
• Achieve and enhance brand standards including strong visuals
• Support achieving targets and drive key results through implementing strategic actions
• Use reports to make commercial and financial decisions that will increase profit
• Be aware of cost... control, how to drive and protect profit
• Be fully responsible for all areas of retail risk and health & safety

Leadership /Teamwork
• Coach and develop talent driving succession, creating strong teams
• Support the management team and take accountability in their absence
• Lead a team by motivating and encouraging teamwork to achieve goals
• Manage performance and give in the moment feedback
• Implement and delegate tasks with close follow up, but lead by example with a hands-on approach

Agile working
• Ability to operate within different roles
• Recognise and adjust to change
• Ability to learn quickly, thoroughly and deliver the detail
• Able to manage challenges and pressure, to adjust quickly to changing circumstances and find solutions supported by management
• Adaptability to variation in work, requiring you to be multi-skilled
• Fast paced and purposeful approach

Decision Making
• Deliver 100% compliance inline to all Company policies and processes
• Implement company decisions and take responsibility
• Seek advice from line Manager /expert and utilise team input when required
• Be well organised and capable of planning efficiently to deliver results

We’re looking for…
• Previous experience at Floor Manager level or be an experienced Supervisor/ Team Leader looking for your next step up
• You may also be a small Store/Deputy Manager looking to move into a larger turnover environment
• Have a good understanding of the latest trends and our competitors
• Have good leadership skills
• Have experience in VM
• Have experience in analysing reports and making commercial decision
• Be able to work on your own initiative
• Be a great communicator and be able to engage your team
• Be passionate about delivering a world class experience to our customers
• Ability to make decisions, problem solve and take accountability with good planning skills

This Is For You...
• Discount - Generous 50% staff discount & uniform allowance so you can treat yourself to our latest products!
• RI Rewards - Reducing Islanders everyday expenses through discounts, benefits, financial advice, wellbeing solutions and more with Reward Gateway! On top of this you will also be entitled to a generous bonus scheme.
• Island culture - Stores fitted with Kindness Cupboards to support Islanders with basic food & hygiene products if needed. We also work closely with the Retail Trust to create dedicated support for all our Islanders!
• Family Hub - Every family is unique, we support Islanders with all different family setups enhanced maternity, paternity, adoption & fertility treatment
• Giver Island - Give as you earn scheme, a ‘Giver Island’ day each year and matched funding
