We mentioned the discount, right?

Keeping You Safe...
At River Island we are committed to the safeguarding of all of our employees regardless of age or job role. We will fulfil our obligation under the Prevent duty which seeks to stop extremism and extremist views from materialising in our business. We promote and encourage the belief in British Values- including democracy, the rule of law, individual liberty and mutual respect and tolerance of different faiths and beliefs. To find out more, please visit www.gov.uk

Every Islander Counts

Our Island is made up of a diverse community, where we all belong and feel part of something bigger. We are committed to equality of opportunity and welcome applications from individuals, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, socio-economic background, religion and/or belief. We will consider flexible working requests for all roles unless operational requirements prevent otherwise

title: Principal Product Manager (Search)
description:
Are you a recognised Search expert? Are you passionate about product-led growth and want to take a central role in leading the #1 travel App across Europe? If so, then this could be the perfect job for you!

Trainline believes in providing friction free train travel experience starting from searching for a journey, boarding the train, to enjoying the stay at the destination. We are a fast-growing consumer business that operates all across Europe – with widespread usage in the UK, France, Italy and Spain. With millions of weekly active customers, we are the no.1 travel app among train travelers across Europe.

You will be joining as a key leader of a dynamic, supportive team of Product professionals who understand the importance of innovation and are passionate about applying it to our products.

Purpose of the role:

• We are looking for the Product leader of Search at Trainline
• The primary part of this Principal Product Manager role will be to define and execute Trainline’s product... strategy and vision for Search, focusing on optimising our products for our rapidly growing international customer base. We are building a proposition we believe customers will be excited by and driving growth of our product through several big investments in customer experience – this role will be to lead one of these major investment streams – the future of Search.
• You'll be the valued expert and custodian of the end to end Web and App journey across all aspects of Search. This will include Customer Experience - ensuring a personalised, dynamic and friction-free experience, monitoring and upholding high quality, performance and stability goals; and Search platform - reducing dependencies on legacy tech, becoming leaner through micro-frontend architecture, and supporting developers with making the right choices to build a scalable, fast, best-in-class search stack.
• You'll take the lead on strategy and plan for at least five engineering squads, including direct management for the day-to-day operation and roadmap for two squads. Each squad will include Engineers of multiple disciplines, and you’ll lead improvements to the product across Mobile Apps, Web and Backend Search stack.
• In addition, you'll line manage at least one Product Manager, and be responsible for their career development.

Responsibilities for this role:

• Be our credible recognised expert in Search, with strong informed opinions and a track record of experience on the domain. On top of innovation, opportunity and best practice in Search in an eCommerce, or technology environment. Be comfortable talking broad strategy and technical detail in all aspects of Search and articulating both opportunities and threats with precision
• Take personal direct responsibility for defining and owning the Search strategy for Trainline and medium/long-term roadmap for your domain.
• Be passionate about customer needs. You have strong empathy and are the customer advocate. You evaluate and understand customer insights and align them to the work your team is delivering to ensure user needs are met.
• Partner with dedicated embedded data science, researchers, and analysts to develop actionable qualitative and quantitative insights. You have a mindset of hypothesis, testing, and experimentation. You have the skill of setting and tracking KPIs/OKRs and product success metrics. You understand the value of learning fast and are able to communicate the hypothesis, insight, success, and failure to a wider audience.
• Partner with dedicated embedded UX Design team to define what and how to radically overhaul the customer experience.
• Work closely with a wider cross-functional team including Tech, PR, Commercial, Marketing, and Finance, to drive customer-focused innovation and achieve impactful results at large scale.
• Be an effective member of the the wider Trainline leadership team across Product and Technology
• Live the Trainline values and behaviours, demonstrating unquestionable leadership and accountability for your Product remit, building a healthy and collaborative Product and Engineering organisation culture

• A track record of experience that makes you a credible, recognised expert in Search. Ideal experience would be taking individual responsibility for in a multi-market, high growth consumer facing business
• Significant track record (8+ years) of measurable contribution in a Product Management role in a Search at-scale customer-focused tech business
• Experience working in a high growth company driving improvements that move the needle. A particular desire to continuously optimise and improve the product experience by motivating and driving a team to achieve data-based metrics (KPIs or OKR targets)
• Worked in a fast-paced environment where you’ve had to think on your feet and bring people together to problem solve
• In depth experience of customer centric thinking through insights, data and experimentation. In particular, experience and understanding of working with large data sets to create product experiences
• Experience leveraging great cross-functional relationships in building an impactful product strategy and roadmap. Partnering especially with Commercial, Marketing and Growth leaders to deliver product experiences that go to market successfully
• Knowledge and experience of working with Agile frameworks, writing user stories, setting sprint goals and collaborating with teams on acceptance criteria

Why should you jump on board?

We want our people to stretch their minds, abilities, and share their knowledge. Each year we hold The Trainline Tech Summit, which provides Trainliners with an opportunity to stand up and share their story, learnings, or new skills with their colleagues in a safe environment.

We've always paid special attention to flexible working as we value a strong work/life balance. The pandemic has taught us that a balance between remote working and being in a collaborative office environment leads to productive teams.

Our Values

• Think Big - We're building the future of rail
• Own It - We care about every customer, partner and journey

• Do Good - We make a positive impact
• Travel Together - We're one team

Interested in finding out more about what it's like to work at Trainline? Why not check out what our employees say about us on Glassdoor? You can also find out more information by following us on LinkedIn or our 'Life at Trainline' Instagram account

title: Principal Product Manager
description:

• Minimum 10 years of technical product management experience,

title: Product Marketing Manager
description:
Marketing at hyperexponential

On the back of an immensely successful 2023 that saw us double our revenue and launch a net-new category, pricing decision intelligence, we’re consistently adding to our client base which now includes leading insurers such as Aviva, Convex, Canopius, Aegis and one of the "Big 5" US insurers. We've achieved a huge amount and this is a testament to both our approach, establishing leadership in PDI and hx Renew’s clear product market fit. Our platform is transforming a multi-billion dollar global industry and our Marketing team is key to driving our demand generation at all stages of the funnel.

Your mission

Product marketing plays a fundamental role here at hyperexponential, both from expanding our reach within our current ideal customer profile (ICP) as well as exploring net-new opportunities.

We’re looking for a product marketing manager that isn’t afraid to roll up their sleeves. Off of the creation of our net new category, you’ll be focused on... building our category leadership and further expanding our growth into new markets and insurance lines. This will include liaising and working closely with both our revenue and technology functions. You’ll also be responsible for formulating and executing on our expansion into new lines of insurance. This will include creating messaging frameworks, sales assets and creating cross-functional go-to-market strategies.

Key responsibilities
• Enhance existing positioning and messaging for our flagship product, hx Renew
• Formulate and execute on our GTM expansion into new insurance lines
• Translate value propositions into impactful content, including pitch decks, case studies, sales sheets, videos, collateral, white-papers and more
• Be cognizant of the industry and competitive landscape and how developments and changes impact hx, our customers and how we stay ahead
• Drive hx presence at industry, partner and third party events, including strategy, content and messaging - as well as on-stage evangelism
• Work closely with regional PR agencies and serve as a product and services champion with press, analysts and other key influencers
• Collaborate with product management to ensure that our packaging strategies always deliver value to our customers and hx
• Partner with content and demand generation on the strategic direction and development of campaigns and content including webinars, the website, white papers and blogs
• Be a customer advocate; make sure that customer content is included in anything and everything we do in marketing
• Build demos and deliver technical and thought leadership presentations

Initial deliverables
• Build out the core messaging frameworks and value propositions for hx for our new market segments
• Partner with Content Marketing to build out our core content for each persona, and each stage of the buyer journey
• Work with larger marketing team to define and execute demand generation initiatives
• Collaborate with product to prioritise feature builds and create customer facing roadmaps
• Attend marketing events as a product evangelist / presenter / facilitator
• Conduct briefings with PR agencies and analysts
• Drive the content and story for our hosted customer conference

Persona
• You have a good grasp of the insurance industry, as well as a deep understanding of complex, enterprise sales and buyer journeys
• You are proficient in translating technical features into clear and concise benefits, and know how to position value that aligns to individual pain points
• You’re an excellent writer, spokesperson and presenter, with the marketing acumen to translate your expertise into compelling content across multiple channels.
• You’re strategic and tactical, creative and disciplined - you enjoy working at the big picture and detailed levels
• You’re a driven self-starter; highly accountable and comfortable working in a fast-paced environment
• You strive to be a subject matter expert, staying on top of industry trends to identify opportunities and challenges for hx
• You have strong interpersonal skills; a great partner to product management and able to build strong relationships across functions

Skills & Experience
• 3+ years in the software industry with 2+ years in a product marketing role (InsurTech/Insurance experience is a strong plus!)
• Technical aptitude along with an understanding of and enthusiasm for SaaS, cloud technology and ideally (but not essentially) Python!
• Proven track record in developing highly effective sales presentations and collateral
• You've run or played a key role in a product launch before
• You've interviewed customers and documented how the product has delivered benefit
• You are skilled at collaborating with product management, engineering and customers to come up with great ideas for content
• Ability to present clearly and concisely in front of executives, vendors, partners, press, analysts and customers.

What do we offer?
• Competitive salary + share options
• £5,000 for individual and group training and conference budget
• 25 days’ holiday plus 8 bank holiday days (33 in total)
• Company pension scheme via Penfold
• Mental health and therapy provision via ⁠Spectrum.life
• Individual wellbeing allowance via Juno
• Private healthcare insurance through AXA
• Top-spec equipment (laptop, screens, adjustable desks, etc)
• Regular remote & in-person hackathons, lunch & learns, socials and games nights
• Team breakfasts and lunches, snacks, drinks fridge, fun office @ The Ministry
• Huge opportunity for personal development and mastery as we grow together!

Interview process
• Initial call with our Talent team to begin the process.
• In-depth interview with your future manager.
• 1:1 with our CMO
• Skills assessment and scenario-based interview.
• Values interview
• We offer!

Stay up to date with our news and updates via our log: https://www.hyperexponential.com/blog

title: Product Manager
description: Blockchain is the world s leading software platform for digital assets. Offering the largest production blockchain platform in the world, we share the passion to code, create, and ultimately build an open, accessible and fair financial future, one piece of software at a time. We are looking for an experienced and technically minded Product Manager to lead the design, development and growth of our products. This is a unique, once in a career, opportunity to deliver mass-market financial products & services on a global scale. We are looking for someone who has experience in - and understands the intricacies of - delivering high quality and innovative internet-scale consumer products, across multiple work streams. WHAT YOU WILL DO: Work in collaboration with the engineers, designers and business leaders to design, develop and deliver crypto products. Lead impactful product launches by coordinating between teams, communicating requirements, managing timelines, uncovering and unblocking... critical dependencies. Use and manipulate data effectively to measure, analyze and optimize the success of the products you develop. Combine data driven insights with product vision & strategy to design new features and improvements to maximize impact and growth. Solve problems and simplify complex issues by drilling into details and the technical aspects of our systems and processes to deliver targeted solutions. Understand our customers using quantitative and qualitative methods. Harness this information to build and enhance products and features that serve their needs. WHAT YOU WILL NEED: A detail and design oriented mindset that constantly thinks about the ultimate customer. Experience in large-scale, consumer facing web/mobile products and applications. A proven track record of shipping products in a technical environment and working with developers and designers on a day-to-day basis. Strong technical skills and experience with analytics platforms and using data to make informed product decisions. Excellent verbal and written communication skills to write thorough feature requirement documents and work with stakeholders and upper management. Experience of compiling and executing implementation timelines and project roadmaps. A background in engineering or computer science is a plus, but not essential. Bonus: Knowledge of, or experience in, the digital currency, banking or FinTech industries. COMPENSATION & PERKS Unlimited vacation policy; work hard and take time when you need it Unlimited learning policy; order the technical resources you need or simply pick something up from our company library Apple equipment Full-time salary based on experience and meaningful equity in an industry-leading company Blockchain is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. title: Senior Product Manager - User
description:
At CV-Library we have a clear vision, we want to help the world to work by matching job seekers and businesses on the global platform they need to succeed.

Our mission is also clear for all our team, we help people find jobs and develop their careers and we help businesses find the talent they need to succeed. This also applies to our own businesses within the CV-Library group too!

We ensure that every piece of work we do at CV-Library ensures we can achieve this, it makes us who we are! We have a fun and vibrant culture where results are expected, recognised, and rewarded. Our people make us who we are, we also happen to be a very talented bunch!

You will join a dynamic and fast-paced environment and work with cross-functional teams to design, build and roll-out products that deliver the company’s vision and strategy.

We are looking for an experienced Product Manager to focus on the Candidate Experience, and to drive incremental business and user impact on our websites.

What... your day will look like:
• Gain a deep understanding of user and business requirements to identify, and fill gaps as well as to generate new ideas that improves customer experience and drives growth.
• Facilitating user interviews and other market research.
• Overseeing quality assurance checks on new features.
• Analyse data and conduct comprehensive research, competitor analysis, and industry trends evaluation to identify opportunities for improvement and to help product management make better-informed decisions.
• Developing roadmaps for the candidate experience that execute on delivering short term value and is designed to strategically scale our product for future growth.
• Work closely with engineering teams and other member of the Product team to deliver with quick time-to-market and optimal resources.
• Drive product launches including working with Sales, Marketing, Executives, and other Product team members.
• Support refinement of the Product Backlog according to changes in functional and non-functional requirements.
• Prioritise the items in the Product Backlog to best achieve goals and missions.
• Be responsible for discovery and delivery stages and ensure that all risks (e.g. regulatory requirements, compliance, security, architecture) are identified and addressed.
• Focus on understanding the friction points in the user journey and work with stakeholders to confirm and validate with prototypes, user feedback and testing.
• Take a data driven approach for measuring effectiveness of new features and establish improvement areas.
• You will need to be able to influence your teammates, as well as colleagues, stakeholders, and key executives, through your use of data and thought process.
• Proven ability to develop product and marketing strategies and effectively communicate recommendations to executive management.
• Technical understanding of and/or hands-on experience in software development and web technologies.
• Strong problem-solving skills and willingness to roll up one’s sleeves to get the job done.
• Demonstrated ability to figure out solutions to difficult problems with many constraints, using sound judgement to assess risks, trade-offs and to lay out your proposals in a well-structured, data-informed narrative.
• Experience of having worked in end-to-end discovery and solution delivery with stringent recovery, availability, operability & resiliency requirements.
• Decision making skills.
• Strong analytical skills (e.g. structuring sophisticated problems into manageable pieces)
• Proactive in identifying the need for change and proposing solutions that are innovative and make the difference in improving our IT software delivery or engineering processes.
• You can understand and challenge Business and Technical Requirements
• You understand solution design and can explain to non-technical customers.

If we haven’t already captured your interest and sparked your excitement at the prospect of joining us, then perhaps the below will:
• 25 days annual leave, plus additional days for length of service and your birthday!
• Regular team incentives and social events, including annual Christmas and Summer parties
• Staff Gift Shop
• Life Insurance and Company Pension  
• Employee Assistance Programme (Mental Health & Well-being support)
• Great culture and work environment
• Access to MediCash

At CV-Library, we are a team. We welcome the best talent to work for us, irrespective of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, veteran status, disability (visible or non-visible).

We are actively committed to promoting a fully diverse and inclusive workforce and we welcome applications for this role from all candidates who meet the key requirements

title: Solution Owner - HVDC
description:
Job Description Summary
Become part of a winning team and help to deliver the Green Energy transition.

The Solution Owner is accountable for the competitiveness of the reference solution, the KPIs inked with the role are cost, time to execute this reference solution against market benchmark.

The Solution Owner leads action plans, involving engineering teams, sourcing and procurement teams and operation teams to bring commercially and operationally quantifiable benefits to the specific solution.

A reference solution’ is a baselined design which encompasses the best practices from previous projects. The solution encompasses all elements of a converter station; strategic, technical and commercial.

The ‘solution’ is not a prescriptive ‘one size only’ design but, rather, emphasises on selling and then building an overall solution that provides the lowest risk by focusing on known business abilities whilst both minimising and managing that which is new.

The solution encompasses the... entire life cycle of a converter station from pre-tender to refurbishment/decommissioning.

The Solution Owner will be expected to actively engage with external activities (Cigre, IEC, conferences, etc.) in order to promote GE and its capabilities aligned with the business unit.

Job Description

Roles and Responsibilities

Strategic:
• Technical solution definition based on customer needs analysis
• Monitor market expectations and competition actions/innovations
• Understand GE IP portfolio related to the solution and freedom to operate
• Recommend major R&D investments as necessary to follow market divergence
• Technical gap management (make or buy)
• R&D requirements definition to maintain and/or develop the solution+ CI

Technical:
• Chair technical change management reviews
• Drive co-ordination between business functions
• Product care liaison

Commercial:
• Cost review and challenge scope definition between GE and partners
• Programme review and challenge

Personnel:
• Build market-place visibility through external engagement

Grid Solutions, a GE Renewable Energy business, serves customers globally with over 13,000 employees. We provide power utilities and industries worldwide with equipment, systems and services to bring power reliably and efficiently from the point of generation to end power consumers. Grid Solutions is focused on addressing the challenges of the energy transition by enabling the safe and reliable connection of renewable and distributed energy resources to the grid. We electrify the world with advanced grid technologies and accelerate the energy transition.

About GE Grid Solutions:

At GE Grid Solutions we are electrifying the world with advanced grid technologies. As leaders in the energy space our goal is to accelerate the transition for a more energy efficient grid to full fill the needs of tomorrow. With a focus on growth and sustainability GE Grid Solutions plays a pivotable role in integrating Renewables onto the grid to drive to carbon neutral. In Grid Solutions we help enable the transition for a greener more reliable Grid. GE Grid Solutions has the most advanced and comprehensive product and solutions portfolio within the energy sector.

Why we come to work:

At GE Renewable Energy, our engineers are always up for the challenge - and we’re always driven to find the best solution. Our projects are unique and interesting, and you’ll need to bring a solution-focused, positive approach to each one to do your best. Surrounded by committed, loyal colleagues, if you can dare to bring your ingenuity and desire to make an impact, you’ll be exposed to game-changing, diverse projects that truly allow you to play your part in the energy transition.

What we offer:

Working in an international team which is part of global Engineering HVDC Centre of Excellence within Grid Integration based in Stafford and Berlin.

A key role in a dynamic, international working environment with a large degree of flexibility of work agreements

Competitive benefits, and great development opportunities

Additional Information

Relocation Assistance Provided: No

title: Staff Product Manager
description:
Requirements
• You are self-driven & autonomous, quickly gathering context to turn ambiguity into fast, high quality decisions.,
• You enjoy collaborating and influencing cross-functionally - not only with the internal partners (customer success, finance, sales, engineering, design) needed to deliver a highly valuable, highly viable product, but with the external customer stakeholders who ultimately choose to use our products,

• 5+ years experience in B2B SaaS product management, preferably in HR tech or CRM,
• Proven track record of successfully launching and managing high-impact 0-1 products, from initial concept through to market launch,
• Advanced technical and data fluency - able to drive technical discussions and quickly make high quality, data-informed decisions,
• Exceptional written and verbal communication skills - concise... comprehensive, and audience-tailored,

What the job involves

title: Senior Product Manager
description:
SENIOR PRODUCT MANAGER
WELLINGBOROUGH (HYBRID)

We are recruiting for a Senior Product Manager to lead the identification and development of new products and services across the Bank. You will have a key role in driving product innovation with the overarching objective is to ensure clients receive fantastic outcomes from Weatherbys Bank.

Ideally you will be based in our Wellingborough head office, with occasional travel to London.

This role has been newly created in response to Weatherbys’ continued growth and as such offers excellent opportunities for advancement within a developing area. You will be joining a team of people who are experts at what they do, working collaboratively to provide an exemplary service to all our clients.

(Wellingborough), free onsite parking (Wellingborough) and a range of discounts and benefits through our Reward Gateway platform.

WHO WE ARE

title: Regulatory Affairs Product Manager
description:

title: Product Management Intern
description:
KAYAK, part of Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG), is the world’s leading travel search engine. With billions of queries across our platforms, we help people find their perfect flight, stay, rental car, cruise, or vacation package. We’re also transforming the in-travel experience with our app and new accommodation software. For more information, visit www.KAYAK.com.

As an employee of KAYAK, you will be part of a global network that includes OpenTable and KAYAK’s portfolio of metasearch brands including Swoodoo, checkfelix, momondo, Cheapflights, Mundi and HotelsCombined. Many employees are dedicated to one brand, but we all have the benefit of using each other’s strengths and insights. Together, we’re able to help people experience the world through dining and travel.

KAYAK is seeking an analytical Product Management intern to join our Product team in Cambridge, MA this summer. If you have experience solving complex problems and thrives in an agile, collaborative and data-driven... environment, come join us!

You will help identify, define and deploy features and enhancements that will deliver a great end-to-end travel experience for KAYAK’s millions of users. This role requires a strong understanding of consumer behavior and an ability to work closely with cross-functional teams to iterate on and prioritize features. The successful candidate will be an expert communicator and multi-tasker, have a passion for designing thoughtful UX on both web and mobile platforms and be very comfortable leveraging A/B experiments to test ideas. If hired, you will combine strategic and operational skills to enhance and grow our Stays vertical!

Note, this role will be required to work from our Cambridge, MA office at least 3 days per week.

In this role, you will:
• Own an initiative to enhance the Stays product from conception to execution
• Develop a thorough understanding of the user journey, using metrics, surveys, user interviews, and the like
• Identify gaps in current functionality and offerings; prioritize ideas for development
• Work with cross-functional teams, as product and project manager, to define specifications and help launch features against realistic goals
• Measure product performance and identify key levers of improvement
• Communicate goals, progress, blockers and launch plans to key constituents across the KAYAK organization, including senior management
• Monitor competitive and industry landscape and stay abreast of the latest technology and capabilities across various platforms
• Coordinate with other product managers and designers to ensure the cohesiveness of the overall user experience

Please apply if you have:
• The ability to complete at least 12-week internship, beginning in May or June 2024
• 3+ years of relevant work experience prior to your MBA
• Good business judgment, technical background preferred
• A desire to become a full-time product manager upon graduation
• Specific experience in both defining and executing strategy, including a proven ability to champion initiatives and drive to key decisions using quantitative and qualitative data
• Demonstrated commitment to developing user empathy
• The ability to collaborate with teams across different functions (e.g., Engineering, Design, Business Development) and different cultures
• Excellent project management skills and attention to detail
• Excellent communication and teamwork skills at all levels of an organization
• Detail-oriented and analytical skills (e.g., SQL, Python)
• Background in consumer products, ideally in e-commerce and B2C, preferred
• A passion for travel with the Trip Stats to back it up a big plus

This role will be paid $40.00 per hour, with a maximum limit to 40 hours per week.

Diversity and Inclusion

We aspire to have a workplace that reflects all of the diverse communities we serve. We know that when we have diverse teams we produce more creative ideas, products, and better outcomes for our team members. OpenTable/KAYAK is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and we welcome and encourage candidates from all backgrounds and experiences to apply for roles on our team. Whoever you are, just be you.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform job responsibilities, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation

title: Senior Product Manager
description:
Are you ready to dive into the exhilarating realm of cryptocurrency and blockchain, where innovation knows no bounds? We are on the lookout for a dynamic and visionary Senior Product Manager to join our pioneering team at Coincover!

If you're passionate about shaping the future of technology, obsessed with the intricacies of product development within Smart Contracts & Ethereum, and have an unquenchable curiosity for Bitcoin, Cryptocurrency, and Blockchain, then this opportunity is tailor-made for you.

Responsibilities

• Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborate with a diverse cross-functional team, including Product, Engineering, Operations, Marketing, UX and Data to deliver critical product development and projects.

• Product Development: Proven experience in coordinating the full lifecycle of product development, including launching features to consumers, through frontend and backend platform development.
• Cross-Functional Coordination: Demonstrated expertise in working with and coordinating operations cross-functional and interdisciplinary working groups (e.g., product management, engineering, data, design, etc.).
• Analytical Skills: Tenacious, self-starter with an ability to thrive in understanding the details of complex, cross-functional projects and distill them into actionable project plans.
• Communication and Stakeholder Management: Exceptional communication and stakeholder management skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to deliver the right message to each stakeholder.
• Adaptability: Energy and patience to work in a dynamic team and rapidly growing industry, while applying a methodical and analytical mindset.
• Simplification: Ability to simplify operational and informational complexity, delivering clarity in the right message.
• Problem Solving: Ability to exercise technical and product judgment in solving roadblocks.
• Team Integration: Ability to be an influential member of a highly integrated team composed of both technical and non-technical members.

Extra mile - knock our socks off!
• You'll have worked in a Crypto / Blockchain start-up!

About Coincover

Blockchain technology is changing everything. However, it brings its own set of unique risks. Coincover exists to ensure everyone is protected, enabling them to innovate freely, without constraints.

Coincover provides a complete blockchain protection solution, addressing the most significant barrier to mainstream adoption: trust. Our protection solutions ensure that access and assets are never lost.

Founded in 2018, Coincover is backed by leading fintech and blockchain investors. Today, we help over 300 of the biggest names in blockchain protect themselves and their customers from theft, hacking, and human error, including Fireblocks, BitGo, and Bitso

title: Senior Product Manager, Seed Startup
description:
Who is Recruiting from Scratch :

Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire. We work with companies funded by the best investors including Sequoia Capital, Lightspeed Ventures, Tiger Global Management, A16Z, Accel, DFJ, and more.

About Our Client

Our client is on a mission to modernize the $220B+ Metal Service Center (MSC) industry – the backbone of America's industrial economy. Through their platform, we aim to transform the $1T metal value chain and digitize metal distribution throughout North America.

Metal Service Centers hold a pivotal position in the metal supply chain, processing and distributing half of the 88M tons of steel produced in the US annually. Essential industries depend on MSCs for everything from aircraft and skyscrapers to automobiles and medical devices... Despite their critical role, MSCs are held back by legacy software from the '70s and '80s, costing the industry over $10B in unrealized earnings each year.

Driven by their customer-centric philosophy, they are pioneering a modern ERP, purpose built to empower MSCs to boost revenue, slash costs, and save time. Our client's platform enables strategic inventory purchasing, streamlines manual tasks, improves the customer experience, ensures on-time deliveries, and accelerates sales growth.

In this role, you will be the first Product Manager on the team and work closely with the founders, design, and engineering to help ship new features and improve existing ones. You will lead in defining product priorities and report to the CEO.

What You’ll Do
• Manage the entire product lifecycle from ideation, design, development, and launch
• Understand the market, competition, and champion our users to craft product strategies that will lead to long-term success
• Understand our client's strategic and competitive position and deliver products that are recognized as the best in the industry
• Partner closely with cross functional stakeholders, including but not limited to Design, Research, Engineering, Marketing and Analytics leaders to build and deliver world-class products
• Clearly communicate roadmaps, priorities, experiments and decisions across the organization from partner teams to executives
• Define metrics and analyze test results to inform the success of products and features shipped

What We’re Looking For
• 5+ years of experience in product management; ideally in a multi-user SaaS and start up environment; experience building collaborative products is a plus
• Demonstrated experience in leading the development of products and features from inception to launch
• A driven generalist, who is experienced and comfortable extending their influence beyond their own product team, leading cross-team and cross-functional effort across a company through influence
• Technical and design fluency; comfort discussing concepts with engineering and design counterparts
• Strong product instincts; the ability to deeply understand user problems and business opportunities and define a vision on how to solve them
• Passion for empowering small business owners to be successful; possess a high level of empathy our customers and a strong desire to deeply understand their needs
• A great communicator who has the ability to influence and build alignment both within a product team and with stakeholders across the company
• Strong ownership, and a willingness to roll up your sleeves to make your product vision come to life

The salary range is $125,000 - $150,000
